After reading all the "single starred" reviews I was getting worried about my purchase. As soon as it booted up though, all my doubts vanished! The phone is so much more better than my old phone! I was using a BLU phone with only 8gbs of internal storage and really wanted an upgrade. And what an upgrade it was! The camera quality is splendid, the performance is remarkable, and the transition was smooth as silk. The battery life is hindered due to the always on function and the already implanted apps that run among Samsung's internal storage,but it doesn't bother me that much. I'm still learning of it's many capabilities, but all in all I'm not disappointed with it yet.

I have been watching my "non-apple" friends for some time now... wondering, watching.I bought a motoroloa cheapo phone just to check out the OS.How did I like the Google options, the easiness of the apps, user interface?LOVED it.So, I started to search for the "Real Deal"and I have been very impressed with the Galaxy S9+.The screen is unbelievably crisp.Camera?Crazy good!Very happy with this phone, even happier it is unlocked so I can test the waters with different providers too.:)

6th month Update:My S9+ is still working great with no problems at all! Great battery life, fingerprint scanner, display and sound!Based on the reviews I read I made sure I was purchasing my phone directly from amazon and not another seller. Everything was brand new, genuine unlocked US S9+ and is working correctly.I put my tmobile sim card in and used included connector to transfer data from my old Samsung S6 to my new phone. I've only had the phone a few days so I am only reviewing how I received and that it is new and a genuine samsung US unlocked phone with 1 sim and sd slot, not 2 sim.

The phone was pairable with Sprint just like the description said. Setting up and syncing the phone with my old Apple's phone took only 30 minutes. It did take a month to figure out how to set the android how I wanted it to, but it works amazing, is more customizable, is able to multitask various app windows, and has had no glitches compared to my Old I phone 7. I would recommend Samsung over Apple any day, and the seller shipped the phone quickly and the packaging was in perfect shape.

column1: Phone worked with Total Wireless. I think it will work with any U.S. carrier.
column2: Nice phone. I'm still trying to learn Android. A little different than my windows phone, which I loved. This phone is fast. Has lots of settings to make it the way you like it. Waiting for the new User interface and new Android. They should be available very soon. I did a lot of research on this phone before buying. I'm not disappointed. I like Bixby which I didn't think I would use but it's handy. Push the Bixby button and ask for help or open apps, messaging, phone, voice mail. Whatever you want to use and it opens. Call phone number, call voicemail, create and send this message. Very quick and helpful.

This came brand new completely wrapped in plastic down to the sides of the phone.The people complaining about it being used clearly bought from a 3rd party seller. I bought from Amazon and it was definitely the unlocked model that works on cdma and gsm.My wife loves her new phone and the new one ui made it easier to switch from apple. It came with all accessories also wrapped.

I bought this phone through the Amazon Marketplace. They had this phone at half the price of what AT&T store had it for. Great phone, Great price. I will never buy my phone through any other outlet then through the marketplace. I don't have to pay a monthly insurance plan, the phone is mine, free and clear. I'm the kind of person that doesn't like payment plans. The phone brand new when I received it and still looks new after 6 months

I saved a $100 by ordering this from Amazon as opposed to getting it through AT&T. It connected to my AT&T carrier the moment we put the SIM card in. The phone is beautiful. I have not had time to thoroughly explore it, but it appears to be working just fine.My phone was sitting on the table this morning and it just went dead. I called Samsung Support and they emailed me a next day air shipping label. They were very good about it and I have no complaints.I do not look forward to being without my phone for a week. There are no service centers in my state - Delaware. I still love this phone.

column1: So Far So Good, Shipping Went Well
column2: Note that this review is of how the product arrived and first day thoughts, it's not in-depth of the phone long-term.Contrary to what a few other customers seemed to have experienced in some reviews, my phone came completely brand new and not tampered with at all. Everything worked fine from launch and all I had to do was transfer my SIM and SD cards over (I use Verizon, the SIM works just fine, no need to contact them.) There's nothing I can see regarding damage or issues with the phone related to how it was sent or what could have happened beforehand.I bought this phone unlocked and new in order to avoid the Verizon bloatware I never used but couldn't manage to get rid of. It was also nice to avoid the hidden fees attached to new phones bought through providers.My initial thoughts are: it's fantastic.The picture quality is stunning, especially coming from a Droid Turbo II (which was a nice phone for what it was, but the screen is so lackluster in comparison.) The camera is beautiful and I could easily say justifies the pricepoint for those looking at the market for photography in comparison to other phones I've seen and I haven't even touched many of the features.The speakers are surprisingly clear and sound great. I've noticed a trend with many smartphones from day one to just have... awful speakers for some reason. Maybe manufacturers assume you're using peripherals and Bluetooth at all times. Regardless, this phone covers that base better than most others.The slim and tall design feels much better in my hand than I was expecting it to, coming from a smaller phone.I love the shortcuts on this Android version and just how the entire Galaxy line operates in general. Samsung has always made stellar leaps in convenience mixed with modernization and the S9+ is no different.As far as Bixby goes: I don't use voice commands on phones, whether it be Bixby, Google Assistant, etc., period. I just avoid the Bixby button (my one caveat with this phone is part of the hardware being designed exclusively for Bixby) so it doesn't apply.I will update this later regarding other things like battery life, communication features, and anything else I can think of after using it for an extended period of time.

A phone with a beautiful glass body with many great qualities. Such as the use of Dolby atmos for an exquisite audio experience and custom audio settings. The infinity amoled display looks immensely beautiful with vivid colors and deep black. Another plus that samsung continued the use of the headphones slot. Battery life is great for everyday normal use, and 5he battery saver settings provide options that greatly extend the battery life of the device. Samsung pay is a very nice feature especially since it can work in more places than other digital payment methods.

column1: Not dedicated to any one carrier.
column2: I like the fact that this factory unlocked Galaxy S6 plus phone is not dedicated to any one carrier. You do not get the non removable junk they install. It fired up immediately and has worked well since. One problem I noticed is that after 48 hours if the unit is operating 24/7, I need to restart it due to clutter. Even when I close all applications after use.Get this one. It is excellent.

column1: Broke my iphone 6s, great replacement till the 5g network gets up running.
column2: This is an upgrade from the iphone 6s.So a lot of skipped generations, and it is clear the technology is step up.Not a giant leap, but very noticeable.Only 2 years old and I'm getting a phone for under $250.A bargain, but not neccesarily a deal.I knew going in that the 5g tech is just coming online so another upgrade within 2 years is almost inevitable.Great phone for the interim.If you just need to tie yourself over a good option.

I just received my s9 today which I got for a great price on Prime day...also got $100 off for opening a Amazon store card. It's brand new..sealed box..charger and usb cord was wrapped in original packaging ..i had called amazon and they reassured me it was new.switched my sim card from my old cricket phone..followed directions to transfer all my info...did have to call cricket to reset my sim card and I was good to go..Will follow up if I have any problems...but $249 for this phone was a great deal

I read a few horrible reviews about not getting a new phone, and for the amount of money involved I was nervous but very happy when I opened the box to find a shiny new phone with all the parts it is supposed to come with.It was an easy install switching contacts and apps from old phone was abreeze and even easier installing SIM card from old phone to new worked like a charm.I am very happy with this purchase!I can't wait to start using it and learning all the cool features!!

You mightcould say Ilove this phone because I was using an Apple iphone 5s before so this is much nicer. Still I feel like this phone is really plenty for anyone.Cost me $230 and I don't have to sign on to a two year expensive phone plan. Signing on to my provider was super easy and everything about this phone has been easy. Takes ultra fine photosand is super fast internet. Really great phone.

column1: Best purchase on Amazon! Love it!!
column2: AMAZING!!! Love it, best purchase on Amazon!! Battery works really well, every function works really well, I bought a used one, it had some bad scratches on the screen, put a screen protector on it and it hides them perfectly. Looks like a brand new phone. Love it, love the edge screen and no screen burn. Love it!

I ordered two for my wife and I.I have AT&T and used a Galaxy S6.I just moved my sim card over and was ready to go.My wife has Sprint and had a I-phone 6.She had to go to the store and get a new sim card.The sales guy was not happy to have to do the work without making a commission sale but... he'll live.There are plenty of ways to move contact to new phones with free apps.The phones were new, no sign of any use.No dings, scratches or finger prints.Started both phones at the same time and they operated in tandem.All the cords, keys and converters included.I have had them for about a week with no problems.100% happy.(Pro tip, pick a color when it's a bit cheaper, most cases cover the entire phone)I'll update if anything changes.

column1: The best thing about this phone: Samsung Pay!
column2: The best thing about this phone, or any latest Samsung phones, is that you can use the Samsung Pay at most of the places where you need to pay across the country!I just had a 45-day around the country road trip, like 99% of the time the Samsung Pay worked(except the gas stations), so I just kept a Costco credit card in my car for gas and didn't need to carry the wallet with me anymore.But sadly the newer model Samsung Galaxy S10 e moved the fingerprint sensor to the side power button, which makes that sensor much less responsive and hard to use.keep your S9!

I was hesitant to order after seeing all the negative reviews but everything is good. Phone arrived new and sealed in box. Inserted my Xfinity mobile sim and it was up and running. Transferred all of my old info from old phone using the Samsung Switch app. If I had any complaints it would be battery life. Not the worst but not the best. I ordered 2 wireless chargers so the phone can easily be charged at home or on my desk at work. Speaker phone quality is fantastic. Camera is one of the better ones I've used. Overall very satisfied with it.

This phone is great. Not cheap,but a bad pick for me. I did not need this much phone. All these features I probably never use. I also have a Samsung tv and I must say it was easy doing the screen mirroring thing. Netflix from my phone to tv. So the phones great and I give it five stars, but being new to smart phones I bought more phone than I need and would not buy it again.

Bought from Amazon, not a 3rd party seller, which I would recommend. Came with everything that was advertised (charging cable + adaptive fast charging box, earbuds + extra bud pieces, USB connector for transfers, SIM tray ejector pin, and of course the Samsung 9 plus phone). Unfortunately, I couldn't use the S9+'s camera to take a picture of itself... so the image quality is from the S5. The camera quality of the S9+ is much sharper if you are seeking to upgrade from one of the older phones, the quality does drop a bit in the slow-mo settings but this is understandable for the feature. Since I have only been using the phone for a few days, I will refrain from commenting too much on the quality of the phone itself, but so far it is what I expected it to be and is performing as such. No hiccups thus far and worked fine while transferring my SIM over from my old phone (T-Mobile for anyone who is curious). The phone also has a lot of features that aren't super apparent, so I suggest you read a bit if you purchase it or do some research to fully utilize the phone.Disclaimer on the photo: the phone does not come with the case, glass screen protector, or the charms. Just didn't feel like taking them off to take a photo.

Great phone - Being refurbished, I wasn't sure if I would have any issues with the products performance or reliability, and to my benefit, it turned out to be a great choice in a phone, and great purchase in general. It came in a fresh new box, in complete perfect condition with all accessories. The phone itself has been fantastic. After almost a year of ownership, I have never had any malfunctions or unexplained issues - it has a great camera, great battery life (nearly all day, about 10-13 hours with my experience, with moderate to heavy usage), a beautiful high quality screen, and performs over all like a premium, flagship smartphone. If you don't feel like spending the money you would be on a brand new phone, and don't want to go for a low price, low performing phone, then go with this one. I have no complaints.

I purchased this phone about 5 weeks ago. I needed something that was unlocked and that would work with AT&T as my Samsung Galaxy Note 4 finally died. The phone has worked perfectly since it arrived. It came new in box with a power cord, wall adapter, and headphones. I did have to take it in to a store to get a new Micro SIM card as the one in my previous phone was the larger type and did not fit in the slot. The battery life is great and the cell signal comes in with no issues.

I love this phone. Got one for me and eventually got one for my wife since she liked mine so much.Best features are the extra ram (whole reason for buying 9+ over the 9, for me) and the speakers. It doesn't sound like a phone. Music actually sounds very nice. I still prefer to cast to a system with huge speakers, but this is very viable. Amazing for a phone.

Just ordered this device to replace an older S7 Edge whose battery expanded on me and took the back of the phone out with it as it expanded - that phone was only three years old but well beyond its warranty.I hope the battery on the S9 won't go the way the S7 did.Enabling the S9 on the Verizon network only involved swapping the SIM card between devices.It confused me a bit because it was my understanding I would have to register the devices exchange on the Verizon website.It happened automatically after installing the old SIM card in the new phone.The device came with Android Oreo from February 2018 installed - needed a couple of patch updates.It also came charged 96%.The S9 has a smaller screen, it's a bit lighter and much more responsivethan the S7 Edge.It could also be that it's new so Android isn't as bloated, although it has all my data and apps moved over.Transferring data and settings was a snap - used the Samsung utility and USB cable adapter to do this.Good experience so far to get going, if something happens, I'll be back here to amend this review.Excellent experience so far with both the phone and Amazon's handling of it.

column1: Bixby is a royal pain in the arse!
column2: I love this phone! I hate Bixby! Size is perfect. Screen resolution is outstanding. Speaker volume is excellent. Samsung UI not as good as Google or LG. As with all smart devices there is a learning curve. Two weeks to adjust from using the Nexus 6p. Bixby needs to go! You can disable the feature but it would be better for me if I could delete the service altogether. Great build and Samsung updates are timely and quick.

The Samsung Galaxy S9+ is bigger than the S9, and holds a charge very well.The cameras take excellent photos.Am still getting used to it, different from the Galaxy S5, my previous phone.The curved edge display looks very cool.A fast moving phone.Lovely design overall.I got the Coral Blue which is a beautiful seashore blue.The phone is a little heavier in the hand than I expected.

Still don't know how to use everything.But screen is good, clarity of sound.Good pics and easy video.But I haven't figured out all the settings and really get annoyed because it is far to easy to trip the selfie setting and often miss shots because I accidentally touched something.Also need to figure out the telephoto, it works great when I accidentally use it : )

Wow, this is a great phone! Very fast with excellent graphics. Comes with some wonderful toys. Some bloatware as well, but the apps are easy to get rid of. I love the fingerprint reader and some of the other security features. And for me it's the perfect size. Even with a cover it fits in my pocket and you don't have to squint to read texts. All in all, I could not recommend it more!

column1: Great android phone with tons of features!!!
column2: Great phone in fantastic condition. Their follow up and customer service is great since my first S9 didn't work properly. They provided me a full refund and I reordered with great results. If your looking to have a great android phone, this is a great choice. Clarity is awesome too.

column1: Great Price, Great Product, Samsung S 9
column2: I received the phones a few days before the promised delivery date.The phones were new in sealed boxes.I had no problem installing the sim cards and transferring the data from our old phones.I watched instructional videos on Utube prior to receiving the phones.I was satisfied with the price and the product.

I upgraded from a Galaxy S7 and this phone has been so much better. The battery life is definitely something to brag about here. I use this phone pretty heavily during the day and it lasts for a very decent amount of time. The fingerprint reader definitely one-upped its grandfather the S7 as it appears to authenticate much faster. The camera has really impressed me after the upgrade. The IP68 protection has definitely been taken advantage of when I want to have music playing in the shower. It’s nice not to have to worry about your phone getting damaged when you get splashed.In the case of most cell providers, you’re better off buying unlocked, as cell companies tend to jack the price up on this particular phone. If you’re upgrading, you can just put your old SIM card in and set up the phone with no issues.

column1: Great price, legitimate and didn't have to deal with AT&T or Best Buy..
column2: Seems like their are some misleading and deceptive reviews on here. Fakespot does has a low rating on this, but my phone was LEGIT!!! Popped in sim card and instantly was on AT&T network after a quick reboot. Phone arrived in Samsung package unopened and perfect. I am a verified purchaser and I can compare, because I had a trade-in deal I used to buy my family member another S9 (at the same time) direct from Samsung. Absolutely no difference.

column1: Mine was new and unlocked and worked on Verizon
column2: Ordered this unlocked Galaxy S9+ on Cyber Monday.Got it for under $500.Read a lot of the reviews on here and many said they got used phones or they weren't unlocked.I took a chance and bought one anyways since I knew I could return it if it wasn't new or unlocked.I couldn't pass it up for under $500.Mine arrived and it was brand new and unlocked!I took my Verizon sim card out of my S7 Edge and put it in the S9+ and powered it up and the phone had to do a quick download from Verizon and another reboot and then the phone was up and running.I really notice the speed difference with the extra 2GB of RAM vs. the S7.Hope this helps with anyone considering purchasing these unlocked phones and Happy Holidays!

column1: Lint builds up in headset jack
column2: Beautiful phone. Quick, a big upgrade from the S8 plus. Three weeks in I found the the head phone jack didn't accept the headset jack. Filed for return then Google the issue. Common problem that lint builds up in the jack port. Remedy; Fish the lint out with a toothpick. Worked like a charm!

column1: Better battery life than my S7 international.
column2: I'm moving from an S7 international 8 core to the S9 and so far I'm impressed. Since new, the S7 had to be on mid battery saver to finish a work day at 80%. The S9 is not on any limiter and I'm getting to leave at 40-50% most days. Screens are comparable, data is 2x as responsive. Bixby sucks. Samsung needs to be rid of it. Fitbit still doesn't like to sync with Samsung devices. But otherwise I'm extremely happy with the upgrade.

column1: It's better than my old S3 was
column2: Samsung's software has improved significantly since the S3 I used to have, and I didn't have to root it to make it look how I wanted it to, as the features were built right in. The screen and battery life are both decent. It has a headphone jack and an SD card slot, both features I absolutely need. The fingerprint scanner works well. About the only issue I have with it is the Bixby button, but I've only mispressed it a few times.

column1: Great phone, arrived exactly as listed!
column2: Very happy so far.I got the S9+ in 64GB black.Product was delivered new and unopened in two days.It was the product code ending in U1 as listed.That's the US version and factory unlocked gsm/Cdma model.I was still skeptical so I brought it to my Verizon store and had then check it.They said it was the real deal, new and had no wear marks inside any of the ports, and even transferred everything over for free while I was there.They verified the serial numbers on the box with the ones in the glass at the bottom of the phone then confirmed Verizon's system had accepted it as well.Very happy so far.Cheers

What a great phone. Sansung has done a great job of updating thetr android os and this thing is beautiful. Fast, great screen, and has sd card capability. This was part of a promotion carried by Samsung and alsk by Amazon. It included a free Samsung "chromebook" which has turned out to be my goto tablet/laptop. Crazy, huh? Very happy with phone connection, messaging and every thing else.

column1: Brand new and perfect right out of the box
column2: I ordered this galaxy s9+ since my galaxy j7 prime is going wacky. When the phone arrived 7/15 new in box,along with a case and screen protector, the next dayI took it to metro and got it set up porting my info from my old j7 to s9+ only took less than 20 minutes.I have been using galaxy S9+ since and just love it.The is no glitches or hiccups, but I always back up my info to be safe.

column1: Definitely worth the price, if not more.
column2: I couldn't tell it was even refurbished. had a small scratch on one of our phones that was on the side and isn't even noticeable unless the case is off. otherwise, everything is perfect. battery life is great, it sometimes needs to charged suring the day, but usually it will last about all day, with max use.
Phone is great, love that I can just put in a sim card and that's it. Not locked by any carrier or service provider.Seller sent exactly as said and condition was great.

Very happy with phone. This is my 3rd Samsung Galaxy phone. It is by far the fastest, feature loaded and easiest to use of all of the phones I've ever used. The battery life is exceptional, as the charging time. Screen sharpness and clarity is incredible. Camera is also what above what I expected. The fact that it was unlocked was a plus, as my carrier's bloat was eliminated, unless I added it.

column1: Worth it compared to S8/plus or Note 9 or any iPhone (Like X)
column2: I love the presentation of the phone when you first open the box. It's was perfectly and neatly set up. USB Type C is my preferred cable since it's easy to plug in and it will be more common in the future. The earbuds are alright with sound. It's not bassy. But it's audio is balanced well. It's also neat that it's anti tangle. I got this phone because I was tired of my cheap Samsung Galaxy J7 Prime from Metropcs. It lagged a lot, horrible camera, and overall poor performance. Now I can play games and multi-task with no lag. The camera is excellent and will be using it to take model pictures of my girlfriend. The stereo speakers is loud and amazing, perfect for videos. I 100% recommend buying this product.

I absolutley love this phone! My husband bought it and gave it to me as a gift and I am extremely grateful for it! The camera is hands-down extraordinary! Crisp, clear, gorgeous images! The speakers are crisp, the head phones are clear and have good bass ability! The internal ability of the phone is on par with expectations. Quick response touch screen and fingerprintsensor, allows for pleasant and accurate performance.

Battery life is very good. Second day using the device. The charge has lasted all day. Unplugged the phone around 5:30 AM and now it is 12 AM. No charging in between. I wasn't using the device much at all between 6:30 am to 2:30 pm. After that, pretty much non-stop use, at 30% battery right now. Once a day charging is very nice. The fingerprint scanner is on the back. It picks up on your fingerprint pretty easily. Faster than my previous s7 edge so far. If I could go back in time, I can say I'll purchase this exact phone the exact way.

It's a Samsung what more do I need to say...I did purchase an otterbox to protect it and the diamond glass covering as well. Protecting it is must as it seems very easy to break and is very slippery without a case.The features of the S9 are good. I haven't used them all and probably won't. Lol I bought it last Nov of 2018 during black friday and got a great deal.

I've been using this phone for over 2 years and no complaints. The battery does become less durable as time goes by but to me it is okay. For the budget (I bought it for $410) I think there are no better phones than this. I'm upgrading to a Samsung s10 lite. Love the s series!

column1: Best buy and it was used!
column2: Great product some scratches on the right side it is used but not that bad I added glass screen protection and the scratches don't even show up till you look really hard with the phone off. But every thing works better than expected I was hesitant but it was worth it I paid $402 flat and not one problem but I did have to switch providers to cricket from boost originallybut really good phone!

column1: It's almost a new phone with fully working.
column2: I received the phone earlier than expected. The galaxy s9+ was almost in new condition. I couldn't find any scratches at all. There was no earphone and the charger was not the original one. But the most important one (phone) was great. I am using it only a few day, but I don't see any issues so far. Very satisfactory.

Unlocked US version, as per description.Works flawlessly with Mint.Battery is long-lasting, fingerprint reader is great (works well even through a thick case, can be used to secure investing and banking apps), phone is fast, good storage, has a microSD slot.I would've loved an unlocked bootloader and replaceable battery, but most folks don't care about that so I'll give it 5 stars.

Only just received in the last day or so. Phone was new, in box, with all items described. Bluetooth file transfer works. Battery lasted a full 24 hours after getting a full charge. First phone call to husband to test phone had horrible static. Hung up and tried again and had no issue. Had several calls since with no issue. Speaker is good. Haven't used the camera much except to take some review photos. Quality is good.

column1: Never Will Buy a New Phone Again
column2: This phone was for my wife. Phone arrived in a custom box from Gizmo Trader. I bought a phone listed as very good. This phone was almost flawless. Downloaded the manual from Samsung and followed the directions for setup and customization. Easy. Works great. Has good range and clarity.

column1: Amazing phone, works great on google fi
column2: Originally ordered to use on Page Plus cellular (a verizon wireless reseller) it worked great but I wanted international travel coverage so moved over to google Fi, the phone has worked great and has been easy to install by just swapping the sim cards. I'm always buying unlocked phones from now on. Regarding the s9+ the battery life is supreme, the camera pictures are incredible, sexiest phone ever built!

I replaced mySamsung Galaxy s6 with a Samsung Galaxy S9 unlocked and this S9 is a great phone.It arrived right on time, and I took it up to my T-Mobile store.They were more than helpful, installed a new sim card, transferred all my info and did all this for no fee.They said it is was a good upgrade.Phone works just fine.I would order from this company again.

column1: really nice phone at a good price
column2: Instead of adding $25 a month to my phone billI enjoy a $30/month bill with my own paid for phone that I can take to ANY carrier ifI want this proved very useful when Tmobile bought Sprint as they were able to migrate me over to the other type of network.I got itnear perfect condition with a 85% battery capacity. For $250

A tremendous upgrade from my S5. Very fast, great signal strength in areas that were a dead zone before and solid.The only negative is that it doesn't have the ability to set ALL text messages witha 5 second delay, as my S5. However it has the ability to delay send built into each message, or you can download an alternate to Samsung's message app.

a really great high-end phone, i love how clear it captures pictures in bright or in dark areas thanks to the Dual Aperture,the most important thing for me in a smartphone is its display quality which this gets right with its gorgeous displaysound is also very good on the studio speakers

First off there was a little issue with deliver but it was resolved very fast.. but once I received the phone it was in amazing quality, practically brand new with no scratch nor sign of wear an tear. Everything function correctly an had no issue what so ever

I've had it for 7 months now and I must say it keeps up to my everyday life. Battery life depends on how u use it but mines typically last me for daylight and it charges in no time. From 0-100 in about 1 hour and 50 minutes the most. If you don't use your phone while it charges. Seeing that the battery only lasts me for the daylight I now think the s9+ is a better buy for me because of the 500mAh more of battery life... But hey I'm not taking anything away from this phone it's still awesome!

This phone is amazing I really enjoy this phone.Haven't had any problems and it's so much better then trying to navigate a iPhone. It has so much customization you can do more then any phone out there. I love Samsung I have so many appliances and electronics and it's a great brand highly recommend this phone.

This unit apparently is not packaged with a SIM card or a removal tool.Since it is unlocked, you can just move your present card over and it starts right up.I had a removal tool left in the box for my old phone.This phone looks and feels great!I don't have experience yet with its features and operations but maybe I can speak for that later.

Snagged this on Prime day. I am happy I did. It was an upgrade for me. Overall I love the phone and features. The screen is vivid, the camera is great! Everything seems to work as it should. The only comment i have is the phone was not sealed. Typically there is some type of security seal and mine didn'thave one. Everything looked new though.

column1: Upgraded from Galaxy 3. Woah! I am in love!
column2: Love the phone. I've only had the phone about 2 months so the battery life is good.I learned that the charging ports in my car really charge this phone slowly and bought a cigarette lighter type charging port that uses the right amps to get a quick charge on my phone.It's worth it to buy the correct Amp charging plugs of you have several cables around the house and car as I do.

column1: What an improvement from the S5
column2: My S5 started freezing up while looking at stored pictures and videos then the battery swelled up.Thus I upgraded to the S9 and everything was better, faster and without problems.All my apps transferred without problem and now they all work without freezing up or buffering.I don't have to worry about managing & deleting unwanted media because I added a Samsung 256Gig sd card.I'm glad I made the purchase because it makes life a little easier.
Really loving my phone.Went from a S7 to this S9+ and I'm highly impressed with it.

I decided to buy a warehouse deal due to the price.I can't even tell it was "very good" condition.Looks brand new.Works perfectly.Battery life great.Picture quality is stunning.I can't find one complaint at all.

Great phone. Upgraded from S5 and this is much better. I like the wireless charging and it has a long battery life. Much faster CPU and memory. Very responsive. More storage and sd card can be added as well. More comfortable in the hand and easier to use. Highly recommend if you have a S5,6, or maybe 7. If anything newer, you should probably get the S10.

column1: Great Value if New Phones are out of price range
column2: I bought this to replace a Samsung S5 which was a decent phone minus the camera and some features lacking. Did me well for 4 years but I got this new S9 on Prime Day for a very deep discount and I am happy with it.I got it for almost half the retail price and it was new.All original packaging so it was true to it's advertisement.

I didn't rate the battery life andFace recognition areas because I don't know about them yet. The phone came exactly as advertised and with all the advertised accessories. I just put my AT&T sim card in and it worked!However, I was not happy with the fact that Amazon prime delivered it a day later than promised.

When I received this phone, I simply popped my Verizon SIM card in and all my apps, contacts, etc downloaded to the phone from my backed up old S6.Of course the S10 came out right after this purchase but I never like to be on the bleeding edge of phone technology.

I bought this phone as a replacement for my Galaxy 7 Edge. I'm an android user and it's definitely top quality, and is really good with holding charge. I can unplug my phone at 7:30 when I leave for work and still have over 50% battery life at 9 or so that night before going to bed.

Camera if quality but could be improved slightly, other than that this phone is awesome. If you wanted a great phone but dont want to spend money on the s10, this phone or the note would hold you over for a year or 2 no problems.

After using the phone for a couple weeks, all I can say is you can not tell the difference between this "used" phone, and a brand new one. Battery life has been good, prefect screen, and just an all around excellent buy !Ty you again !

Great phone for everyday task. Great picture, have not had connectivity issues. The disappointment is finding a good glass replacement at a reasonable price. So far I have purchased 2 S9 Plus phones, and one of my coworkers purchased one because of me. My future upgrade will be an S11, Right-now, it's pointless to get the S10.

column1: Really happy with the phone , working perfectly
column2: Really happy with the phone , got the phone over a month ago, working perfectly no issues whatsoever, the only downfall was the box, came with an ugly tape around it and was impossible to remove without ripping some of the box off, the earphones sound quality is good, I was able to transfer all files from my old phone, unlocked as advertised, working with Telcel, I recommen it.

Arguably the best smartphone that I've ever purchased.Works great and plenty of great features.Great camera.
I had no real problems switching the SIM card from my old phone to the S9+.So why did I give it only 4 stars?Well, I find Bixby of little value for me and I accidentally press its button at times.Also that Facebook is permanently installed (can be "disabled").However according to my router of my WiFi network, there is communications to and from Facebook (unknown which source/app on the phone is the cause).
Good price..about 100$ less than other similar used ones on Ebay. Phone works fine, no issues. Came unlocked for use on any carrier as promised..put on Verizon prepaid and it works fin
I love this phone! It looks brand new and is very fast. I've wanted an s9+ for a long time and now I have one that was very affordable. It transferred all my data in less than 5 min. Well worth it!
Needed a new phone to control my Mini 2 drone. Took a risk and order a used phone. Long story short the phone is perfect in everyway. Even the battery is like a new phone as far as how long it lasts.

Got this for the kid. He really likes it. Best part was no reactivation fee. The previous chip we had worked automatically when installed. You can save battery life it completely turns off all apps. Works greatvery happy

column1: Delivered unlocked as promised in new condition - great job Amazon
column2: It is an AT&T model with all their "free software" installed.New condition, delivered in a timely manner.Very good value and great Amazon service you can depend on.Very pleased.The device is standard Samsung, solid build quality and dependability.Excellent (for the money) AKG ear buds which I find to provide far superior audio quality and comfort to the ones Apple gave me with the XR.Excellent screen and very good battery life compared to my S7.

column1: So far, so good!  Compatible with our phone company
column2: My biggest fear of buying this unlocked phone was that it would not be compatible with our phone service - we use Total Wireless which is on Verizon's CDMA system.It worked perfectly - went through the set-up process in approximately 15 minutes.Just got them for Christmas.Will update review after using for awhile to rate battery life and other features.

column1: A great phone.  Just what I was looking for.
column2: This is my personal phone replacing my galaxie s6.It works so much smoother than the s6 although it was a good phone.I just wanted to upgrade and glad I did.I have only had it about a month but so far so good.Some things I am still learning on it but pretty much the same.Picture quality is great.I have verison no contract and just changed out the sim and was ready to go.I had to download an app to transfer my pictures.I had a glass cover put on to protect the screen and they had to put six on before they could get one to stick.It should be good to go now.

Phone arrived in full working order, with the model in description. Tested good on AT&T network (although I did have to have customer service reset the SIM and program it appropriately - keep this in mind if your mobile data doesn't work right away - the stores don't always do what they should)Very happy with the phone.

This phone is AMAZING! It arrived on time and in perfect condition. The picture quality and sound is terrific. It works perfectly with my daughter's T-Mobile account. Was apprehensive at first but the phone is everything that was advertised. Would highly advise buying through Amazon directly not a 3rd party vendor.

I'm in love with this phone. I was really hesitating between this Samsung that had amazing reviews or (yet again) buy a new iPhone. I used to think iPhones were the best smartphones on the market. Well, I'm happy to say I was proved wrong. This phone is really impressive, it works really smoothly and has an amazing camera, even for rookies like me. Don't regret the change from iPhone!

I recieved this yesterday, went to Verizon today. All up and running.Yes a brand new item. Came with ear buds, charger, all necessities. I haven't used the phone long enough to review it, other than lovely screen and it works. The seller sent exact item as described and quickly.I purchased from Emily's Store.

column1: Buy new from Amazon, not some other shady sellers on here
column2: Got scared when I was reading the reviews after I already bought this because people were saying they only got a box, or the phone stopped working, or stuff was missing. But I am assuming these were all purchased from other sellers or refurbished or used. Amazon has all reviews from different sellers lumped into one. Got mine new from Amazon.com Services Inc. seller and it came with everything, including fast charger box and cable and headphones. Phone has been working excellent, great battery life.

Great brand new Android phone "sold by and shipped from Amazon.com" at a decent Good Friday sale price.Delivered in 10 days with free standard shipping.I brought it to the local T-Mobile store (USA) for initial free setup (purchased new sim card) and it works perfectly on their network.I've had it for about 5 weeks now without issue.Battery charge lasts 3-4 days under light usage, taking care to close background apps, regularly optimize battery (under Device Maintenance) and power off the phone at night.

I bought this during Amazon's 2 day July sale & I love it.I have the samsung galaxy 8 plus and it was too large for my hand along with other issues (i.e. camera stopped working, apps - life360, ring, etc. did not work correctly).I used the Samsung Smartswitch &transferred everything over to my new S9.All I had to do was take it & have the sim card moved over for it to work perfectly with my cell number.
I decided to switch carriers and was looking for a good phone at a good price. This fit the bill. I'm up and talking and texting. It has a lot of features I've not tested yet.

I don't use finger print reader or face recognition, but the second day I had the phone I had to charge it three times, all though I did use it a lot that day to download apps and set the phone up. Sprint would have done that for me but my last phone crashed and they could not recover anything but my contacts.

column1: Excellent phone, $150 off retail! Works out of box on Verizon LTE
column2: I was nervous buying this from an Amazon seller but now that I have had the phone a few days I am very pleased.Battery got hot the first charge but has been fine ever since. Accubattery App shows that the battery is working well. Beautiful design, vivid color and for less than you would get it from Verizon, anywhere else. Especially if you have Prime!!

Great phone that is unlocked. It works for verizon as well. Best price for this phone was $740 on amazon. Compared to best buy and verizon they all wanted 950 and why bother at that point might as well get the newest samsung note 9 for $1,000. The battery life will last you all day with regular use and with the quick charging feature its nice. You can charge it up from like 50% to 100% in like a hour.

I got this on Prime Day for $300 from a Samsung dealer direct.It is well worth that.Obviously buyer beware if you're dealing with a third party retailer, but in terms of the phone itself, it offers everything you expect from a flagship product.

I purchased this device to replace my other S9 that had been destroyed. Came packaged well and presented as brand new. Had NO problems at all linking this to old accounts, contacts, etc. before activating the phone service.Took the phone to Verizon, activation took less than 10 minutes with NO hiccups. I'd certainly recommend this supplier.
Not much of an upgrade from the S8 but I'm happy with the location of the fingerprint sensor.

The company was fantatic with their customer service when I had an issue with the phone. They were professional and prompt when returning any inquiries I had, and they were very easy to work with. I would buy another product from them.

column1: Great Samsung Galaxy S9 Unlocked smartphone
column2: I was a little nervous to order this phone through Amazon after reading some reviews, but I have had absolutely no issues. I am very happy with my purchase. It was easy to set up and transfer all my information to this phone. I was also able to easily register my phone to ensure I get the full manufacture warranty.

Its been almost 3 weeks since I had this and so far I feel this might be the greatest samsung phone ever the speed is insane fast, quality is amazing, the battery is based off how much you use it overall I can go one full day without charging it and that's if I use it all the time if I dont more than a day If you get this phone and experience battery drain quickly watch YouTube videos that was the 1st thing I did as soon as I got it to optimize it

column1: Phone worked as intended. One major scratch. At&t unlocked phone.
column2: All features work as intended. Battery life is B+ to A-. AT&T unlocked phone.Screen has a deep scratch about an inch in length. May buff out. Some small scratches all over but barely noticable. Ear phone speaker sounded half blown, took it to shop where they cleaned it. Took them 2 minutes and now works as expected. Was worth the price in the end.

column1: It's worked for me for 2 years
column2: I've used this phone for 2 years and it's continued, as far as I can tell, to function almost good as new. I drive a lot for work and the battery is able to last me through the work day while running Google maps. I have experienced mild issues while running apps that require a lot of processing power, but nothing worth replacing the phone (at least for me).

Like the size and features of the phone.Ease of transfer of files...all except two important apps I still cannot get to work, waiting on a solution from the company...phone arrived well packed and earlier than expected.

Ive been using this for a few days now and I love it. It has a great camera and loud speakers! I havent used a samsung since the s3 came out, so it took some getting used to again, buy so far so good! I dont have any complaints yet.

The phone I received was in mint condition and I would rate as near mint. Not a single scratch or blemish on the phone and everything works perfectly. I will dant one star 4 battery life because it doesn't last of us more than 24 hours. I will definitely buy a from this vendor again

This phone is fantastic for the price.You can even shave the back off 2 200 Gig SD cards glue them together and take the phone up to 400 gig on SD. Finger and face recognition is working flawlessly.Size is great the weight is reasonable and reception has yet to fail me.

I purchased a black Galaxy S9 for myself in November. My fiancé liked the look of it, so I upgraded her to the blue one, from her S7 for Christmas. She absolutely loves it! The only thing I was disappointed with, was that I couldn't find one in Rose Gold, which is her favorite color for her phone and accessories. Thankfully, I found a Rose Gold case for it. We're a true #SamsungFamily!

column1: Glad I didn't let the reviews scare me away from this phone!!!
column2: Well I just received it today and everything was in the original box with all documentation. All accessories we're new in the box and well so far so good!!! It's a Verizon phone I just called my provider Metro PCS and they switched it over and it only took about 5 mins and it was up and running! The phone is beautiful and man I can't wait to figure it all out the resolution is insanely clear.

Awesome phone. Excellent battery life. Tempted to give 4 stars just because Facebook came preinstalled. I buy factory unlocked phones because I want NO bloatware. FYI, the bootloader can not be unlocked if you are in to that thing.

I absolutely adore my phone. It's super fast and I love that the fingerprint reader is on the back. This makes it super easy and convenient when unlocking the device in a hurry. Also, the battery life is insane! It lasts for a full day if you're on it all day.

Moved over from an iPhone 7 .If you can extract yourself from iOS (easier said than done), this is a great phone.Phone itself: excellent call quality. headphones are really nice and there is a headphone jack with no dongle and you don't HAVE to use bluetooth. charges so quickly.Camera: Fantastic in every way.Muzak: Am still a little confused on the various Samsung apps, esp Samsung Music which is so weird. Listening to music/ videos is really nice on this because of the full screen and the front facing speakers.Size: This is a great size ... perfect for me. I am a medium build person with medium sized hands. I did not want a phablet. This phone feels like something between an iPhone 7 and 7+ for comparison. Don't know how it actually compares but feels smaller than the iPhone +.Get a case on this thing. I am using the SUPCASE Unicorn Beetle ... it's thin and grippy.
Great phone for calls, pictures, games, video. The whole package. Battery life is great. Most Samsung apps are useless, but Samsung pay is very convenient.

This is a great phone. I just upgraded from an HTC phone & the Galaxy S9 plus makes it look like a toy. I'm in a not so great service area & so far so good. I also had problems with Wi-Fi in my house with the other phone & so far have had no issues with that.
The phones were in very great condition. They booted and set up very easily with the added instructions. I am extremely happy with this purchase. Thanks for your focus on quality.

column1: Boost mobile WILL NOT let you get away with it.
column2: Several reviews said this unlocked phone would be fine with Boost Mobile.Took it into a boost store and the lady behind the counter was really nice and she tried and tried and could not get it to work with Boost.Even though Boost sells this exact same phone.... hmm...Nice gimmick, boost.She did say the phone was sprint compatible.Boost is owned by Sprint and its phones will run on the Sprint network.So, what gives Boost?

This was not to difficult to set up on verizon, just have to dial *86 to get voicemail. Put in the sim card from my old phone, signed into my google account and the phone was mostly ready to go. Love the phone, super slick. A little extra work for unlocked but not that big of a deal.

column1: 1 year in, phone still works perfectly
column2: hasnt slowed down one bit, I do software updates but I don't update apps until they just dont work anymore.Picture quality still perfect, wifi signal works fine, SIM card works fine in EU and US (it connects to T-Mobile in US, and LEBARA in London, and I think it was Orange in other countries in europe)

column1: If you know you want an S9+, this is a fine place to get one
column2: Talking about the S9+ itself, the phone is fantastic. Near top of the line specs and user experience. Nearly perfect smartphone. You should research the phone itself and its specs yourself, thoughAs for this particular product from this particular seller, it arrived pretty quickly and came brand new with fully intact packaging including all of the extra cables and pieces. Buying this phone from this seller is just as safe as buying it in person, I can assure you

column1: Stopped working properly after a couple months!
column2: I purchased this phone some months ago and was extremely excited to try it out. It arrived perfectly with all the parts and pieces it was supposed to come with and for the first two months I was completely satisfied with my purchase. I'd also took measures and purchased a heavy duty phone case and a screen protector to make sure this puppy lasted me a while. However, two months in, my phone started unexpectedly freezing and the battery life was starting to decline rapidly. I had only used 18 of the 64 GB available but I took the time to clean out my storage and any unnecessary files anyways in hopes that the phone's behavior would improve. To my surprise, its performance was rapidly declining more and more by the days. Not long after it got to the point where my phone screen would randomly turn itself off and not turn back on. The phone would vibrate like it would when it was on when I'd press the home button but the screen would not light up. It would do this multiple times a day and I would have to manually soft reset it every single time. I reached out to Samsung support and was not able to receive any help or answers from them. By this point my 30-day warranty had already expired and Amazon would no longer be able to exchange the phone for me. I wish I had just spent a few dollars extra to make sure that I had received a reliable phone. Very unsatisfied

I love the looks of this phone (even tho I have have covered it up with a heavy duty case) Operation has been perfect. Easy to set up, and hook into my phone carrier (mintmoblie). It arrived quickly and unopened packaging in perfectly new condition (thanks Zeroforfive).

After reading other reviews I was really hesitant to buy this phone. I finally decided to give it the go ahead, and am very pleased. Phone arrived with no defects or scratches, activated it on MetroPCS with no problems. Definitely 5 stars!

Got this as a replacement for my S5. Couldn't be happier. Phone works as it should and hasn't disappointed yet. Nice new phone all numbers on box and phone (IMEI numbers) matched and started using straight away with our current carrier.All functions of the phone work properly and without issue. Will updated later of any issues arise.
Great buy. No more $1000 phone. Bought this S9 for $265 w/tax and it's worth every penny. Have had the phone 2months now and it works perfectly.

So far I am impressed with this phone's features and screen quality.I had no problems using it in the Tracfone BYOP program and was able to connect to the network with the best signal strength in my area (Verizon CDMA).I bought the Tracfone sim kit on Amazon.
2 year review went well so far.
I am not a huge Samsung fan, but this phone has proven fantastic. Got the phone right away and it was easy to set up. I use Total Wireless with no problems at all.Great battery life.

I like my galaxy S 9+ very much, is very fast, takes awesome pics, sound it's great. My disappointment is that it doesn't have video chat, can't set up individual messages alert tones, can't set up wallpaper on messages, background is plain white, very boring. Besides that it is a good quality phone.

I'm pleased with my purchase and the phone. It's everything I thought it would be and more.Just one thing to note,it doesn't come with an FM tuner app,you have to download and install NextRadio for it to work.The app no longer supports streaming but allows you to access your local stations using your earphones as an antennae.

Great phone especially for the price. It does not come with box, charger or any other accessories but that was fine as that stuff is inexpensive.Thanks for supplying great phones reasonably priced. I bought it for my son and he uses straight talk. Worked perfectly amd he was ecstatic
Purchased as a gift but the person loves it.

column1: Setting up was a little tedious
column2: Setting up was a little tedious, but overall it’s a very good buy , it’s going to take some time for my wife to get accustomed to it , she has had an I-phone for years and was a little concerned about switching , but she’s slowly coming around

It's an awesome phone. I looked around and waited and researched before buying a phone online...I was hesitant. But it came brand new and works beautifully! I've had it for over a month now with no issues. The touch screen is extremely sensitive with the screen curve, so I've been hitting the sides of my phone by accident. Other than that I'm very happy with my purchase!

Bought this phone to replace my Droid Turbo after years of use, and I'm very happy with this one. In comparison to the other phones I've had, this one takes about 30 seconds to restart itself (which is wonderful if you're someone who usually only restarts it when it's absolutely needed). The picture quality is awesome as well as the sound quality. However, if you're playing music on full volume, there is a bit of a tinny noise in the background if it goes to a super loud part. I love the battery life, but be careful not to leave it plugged in after it fully charges to avoid shortening it. My biggest complaint is probably the case out of everything (which I realize isn't really the phone but kinda has to do with it). You see, this phone has a curved screen (which is unique but kinda a pain in the butt) and the way that Otterbox designs their cases for it, the screen protector piece is just a thick plastic part with adhesive which doesn't tuck into the sides of the case. While maybe this wouldn't be such a huge problem on flat screens, the curved screen made it ridiculous since the protector kept sliding and popping off. But if you can deal with that, I say go for it.Lastly, I know someone have had issues with activating it, but to be honest, I didn't run into any problems. I just brought it into Verizon and had them hook it up. I spent about ten minutes in the store overall.

column1: Love it! And great place to buy it here
column2: Works great! Brand new! I love it!! This is a great one to buy no sham! I've had this phone for about a year now and I'm still obsessed with it and it still works like new!

This S9 is the fourth Galaxy I have owned; it is by-far the best one of all. This phone is more like a computer in my pocket than a phone in my pocket. The pricing was within my budget. It did not have a "quick-start guide" or an "owner's operating manual," but that didn't bother me because I knew I could get an owner's manual on the Samsung website. No problem getting it, but 54 pages later, I couldn't find the information I needed. This did not bother me until I received the phone and had trouble figuring out how to "make it work."The operator's manual is written in a style that is "WAY OVER MY HEAD!! AND the "quick-start" guide that came with each of my other Galaxy phones WAS NOT online.The young woman to whom I spoke (via text) at the Samsung Help-line was very helpful, told me all kinds of things to do, which most worked. However, 7 days later I still could not use features of my phone that needed an internet connection when I was not in-range of my internet. The seller did not put me in touch with his "tech person" or perhaps didn't have one, but instead kept telling me to call Samsung, but Samsung rep kept telling me to go back to the seller. In fact she even told me to consider returning the phone, as it appeared, to her, the phone was defective. The seller kept stalling me about a return and sounded like he had run out of patience with me and just wanted me to disappear.He finally told me to try resetting the APN. I should know what APN means??? He seemed very upset with me that I hadn't done that when I first turned on the phone. I would have, except the machine that walked me through setting up the phone did not mention the APN. In fact, he sent me a phone that had not been "cleaned" of the previous owner's data. I did a factory reset on the advice of the Samsung rep.I'm not mentioning the seller's name or company name. I want to give him the benefit of the doubt about the product he sold.
I've had this phone for about a year now.It works great.Crisp pictures and great battery life.I got another for my work phone and bought another for my wife.Overall great smart phone.
I switched from a Moto G4 to Samsung S9 and there is NO comparison.The Samsung functions!It holds the wi/fi.I haven't used the fingerprint reading or iris reading.

column1: Everything I've been looking for in a phone.
column2: I'd like to start out by saying I've never had any of the previous galaxies, so I don't know how the S9+ companies to previous models. That saying, I absolutely love this phone. I recently switched to the Galaxy S9+ from the ZTE Axon 7 because of the limitations on that phone. The Axon 7 is a really good phone, and although it is an android, there are a lot of differences between that phone and Samsung Androids.The Galaxy S9+ has a great battery life, I charge it using the wireless fast charger in the morning before work and it will last all day through a 10 hour shift plus the gym. I like all the security features like the fingerprint scanner and face detection. It also has great memory and runs easily. I can do multiple things at a time and have multiple windows open and it's not a problem. The sound is also really good, I don't have to turn it up as loud to get the same quality music as with my old phone and the display for the screen is awesome. I take pictures and they look like they are in hd. By far one of my favorite features is the edge panel where you can put frequently used apps and contacts and such. I use that all the time.So far I have no complaints. I've been using this phone for about a month and I'm in love with it. Also buying it through Amazon using their store card and 24 month financing was a plus. That's the only way I could afford such a high price phone.I would definitely recommend this phone to someone else. I never rate anything 5 stars, but as of now the Galaxy S9+ is worth it.

Bought this when it was on sale around Thanksgiving of 2018. About half the price of iPhone and it is just as good, if not better!!And no need for all that iTunes crap. Using this phone with MintMobile 3Gig/month for $15 plan and i'm saving lots of money.

This phone is nothing short of amazing! It's my first top of the line premium phone, and I never knew, until now, what I'd been missing. It is blazing fast, the screen resolution is fantastic, and it can do so many things that I will be constantly discovering new functions. The dual speakers with the Dolby Atmos, sound so absolutely terrific, it's amazing that Samsung can pack so much sound into such small speakers. My last Samsung phone was a Galaxy Mega with the 6.3" screen, and I loved the huge screen on it, and that is my only lament about the S9+, it has a 6.2" screen, so you'd think it isn't that much smaller, but it is quite a bit smaller. Not length-wise, but smaller by a bunch height-wise, and I've missed that on every phone I've had since. That is the one thing that would make the S9+ absolutely perfect for me, a screen that big, but, I'll live without it in exchange for how great the rest of this phone is. I highly recommend this phone if you can possibly afford it, it's really outstanding.

Had a J3V, decided to move into the big girl arena and get an S9.Did my research and figured I could do the work to replace my phone with my current carrier instead of paying them to do the work.I had to have a friend of mine show me how to access the sim/micro sd card port.Switched them out, turned on the phone.It walked me through how to attach the included cable and attachment to my j3v.Transferred and Bam! It works.Went out to my carriers website and already show up.No problems.The only thing you can not do with your carrier (you should check with yours) is that you can not get insurance on a phone unless purchased through your carrier.That being said, if I choose to get another phone, I will definitely be buying an unlocked one from here again.

column1: I can't believe I scored this EXCELLENT phone for $280.96!
column2: I stumbled across this in the Amazon Warehouse & couldn't believe the deal! I purchased the Lilac Purple, S9, Factory Unlocked, US Version, 128GB. This phone is in excellent condition & appears brand new! The box did have a tiny bit of damage (paper was pealing on one side), but it came with the manual & all original Samsung extras. I've attached pictures showing the minimal damage to box & excellent condition of the phone. The listed description was "Condition: Used - Very Good - Minor cosmetic imperfection on top, front or sides of item. Missing manual. Item will come in original packaging. Packaging will be damaged."What I received was MUCH better!I've had the phone for maybe 3 hours total & am still playing with settings. There are many features I haven't tried yet, such as face recognition. I also can't say how long the battery lasts, but I can say that the high speed charger is super fast. The phone came charged at 50%, & it took maybe 45 minutes to reach full charge. My only complaint so far is the length of time that it took to receive my order. I ordered this phone on April 28 & just received it today, on May 13. Yes; we are in the middle of a pandemic, & I know that everybody is ordering things online which is slowing Amazon down, but 2 weeks felt like a lifetime. This phone was a replacement for my problematic phone & I very badly needed the replacement ASAPPros:* I still can't believe that I got this phone for $280.96!* I LOVE the color!* It's in excellent condition! I'd honestly think it was brand new if I didn't know better.* I love that it has 128GB, with the ability to expand with an extra 140 GB micro SD card.* The camera is such a big improvement over what I had previously. The pictures above were taken with my old cellphone's camera. (The picture of my cat is the one shot I took with my S9).* I love the security features - face recognition, irises, & fingerprints.* The screen is so much nicer, clearer, & pleasant to look at.* It has a nice snappy response.* I love that I can use a wireless charger if I want to.Cons:* It take a long time to get here - stay at home order considered & all.I wanted to post this review to help ease the mind of anyone considering purchasing it, but scared off by the negative reviews. I will revise this later if needed.

Went out for my birthday on Saturday amd was seated poolisude for a romantic dinner...but my phonefell into the pool. Took the hosts over 15 minutes to retrieve my phone frm the bottom of the pool. I wasnt too far from hopping in there myself. I knew I would miss my phone but wasnt too perturbed about the pic since Iupload to Amazon Cloud.... Someoneseated at the table next to me said I sure hope that is an Iphone 8 then you have a chance..If not oh Well!!! I said nope,,,no Iphone. When at least the phone came out erytone wasamzed that it seemed undisturbed... screen as clear as daylight. They turned it off quicklyand went to put it in rice just incase. The usual advise to keep it turned off for 3 or so days. When i got home being theinquisitive person that I am...I turned it back on to sneak a peek. It was still as good as gold. No apparent water damage. I semt a text and turned it off. At that point I also wanted to credit the new phone case i had bought just over a month ago. I will do that separately but i did notice that it kept the back of my phone completely dry inspite of it being submerged all that time. I was certain that at least the charging port and other entry points would be ruined. I left it in the bag of Rcie for Sunday although visually i really had not reason to. So i decided to finally research the phone ...to my surprise i learned that it is water resistant and under some conditions can reminared submerged for up to 30 mins. So I turend it back on and have been going problem free. amsung S9 proved its worth. I am slo obviously very blessed. I would not suggest that you try itbut I can tell you if it gets wet you have a pretty good chance of being ok.I would still recommend the rice to draw away any water.

(It still gets 5/5 stars because the phone was functioning perfect, just doesn't work on Sprint)Okay, so after trying to activate the first one at Sprint, they said the phone was either the international version (it doesn't appear to be) or it was locked (also doesn't appear to be). So, Amazon was super helpful in exchanging the phone for another, saying the serial numbers must have been confused.I try to activate the second one, and run into the same exact issue.Sprint does NOT have the IMEIs of these phones on their list of eligible devices, regardless of everything (model/unlocked/unbranded) pointing to this phone being eligible.Other carriers experience may vary.

Now this phone would be the ideal phone for a younger person or ppl with small fingers and can see will. Since I’m either the reason for the stars. I went from a iPhone 6 Plus to this and have wanted to busted it up every since. It’s not the phones fault. It’s mine because I can’t see it well and my fingers are to big to text correctly. I’m always hitting button I didn’t mean to and have to erase and retype most of my text. Maybe should have went with the plus size. The volume is a little low for my hearing and I didn’t think my hearing was bad. I find sometimes I have to hold it up to my ear to hear somethings. I don’t know if it me or the phone. The battery life I have to charge it every night. I am not a person to stay on my phone all day. Just general text,Facebook and maybe play a game for a bit. There maybe things I can turn off to extend the battery which I have turned to YouTube for some advise but I still didn’t find anything to help extend the battery. Overall, after being so excited with getting a chance to have one of these phones I am disappointed with it. I’m 41 years old so I’m not over the hill. I wish I could go back and buy the plus version. So on this one be your on judge.

column1: Can only use with SIM cards.
column2: I bought this phone because it could be used with CDMA and SIM cards both.I had planned on using Verizon at home and wanted to be able to purchase SIM cards to use in the phone when I travel internationally.But this phone appears to be an AT&T phone that is "unlocked" so that it can also be used on T-mobile and presumably, other SIM cards.I have wasted a week's time, tried a couple of different SIM cards from a couple of different carriers, purchased a new SIM card, and am just DONE with this.Do not believe the Q&A section where it says the phone can be used with all 4 carriers.It absolutely CANNOT.I will be returning this.

This is my first time buying an unlocked phone online and I feel like I got more than I bargained for. The Super AMOLED screen is hands down one of the best I have seen on a smartphone and I am enjoying it very much. Same goes for the speakers.In addition to that, I got to "pixelize" my phone, download tons of apps, files and I have to say I have not suffered from the infamous samsung lag, but if it does slow down at one point, samsung does have a function to test, diagnose and optimize your phone so I plan on taking advantage of that in the future.I'm also very satisfied with the battery. I'm a heavy user and so far it has been lasting me for a full day whereas my previous phone needed to be charged twice per day.As for the camera, I have yet to fully test what it's capable of, but I've taken a few low light pictures and have been quite impressed by how nice they looked.All in all this is a great phone and definitely a worthy purchase.

column1: Awesome Phone! Love it More Every Day!
column2: UPDATE: Well, I've had my S9 plus for almost 2 mths now & I see it more every day! It's so fast compared to my other phone! I'm really glad I took the plunge & ordered this phone.I was really nervous about ordering this phone after reading the reviews, but after receiving it, I'm so glad I ordered from Amazon. I didn't order from a third party seller. The phone came packaged in a huge box surrounded by air pockets plastic. Everything was sealed and looked brand new. Still, the first thing I did was contact Samsung to verify that this was a new phone with a valid 1 yr warranty. They assured me that it was indeed new and had a 1 year manufacturers warranty. When I tried signing up for prepaid service, the IMEI number only worked with Verizon. After chatting with the sales reps online, he assured me that wifi calling would work. I was doubtful after reading multiple reviews online, but figured I'd it didn't, I could go with T-Mobile next month. I called Samsung again after signing up with Verizon and the rep at Samsung said my phone was unlocked & would have worked with any carrier. Yesterday, when I got my Verizon Sim card & put it in, no wifi calling. I checked again in a couple minutes & boom! I had all kinds of features that weren't in my phone before including wifi calling and HD calling. So happy with this phone. It's lightening fast, the screen is brilliantly beautiful & the pics it takes are unmatched. Plus, no unnecessary apps that I had on my Galaxy S7 Edge from AT&T. Love this phone.

I love Samsung phones but not this one. I upgraded from a galaxy 6 to the 9. It has so many issues that I just went back to my 6. Positive: transferring everything from my 6 to the 9 was easy peasy. This phone has an incredible battery life even when I play games on it several times a day. That's about the only thing I really like about the phone. The thing I noticed the very first day was the picture quality was blurry on all my photos that I took. That's the main thing I use the phone for. I tried several settings, but photo quality still remains to be an issue.For the first few weeks, my phone would actually show me notifications as to when I had emails, but then that just stopped. I checked every setting and even turned on the sound for the emails. Nothing. I did the 7 "fixes" suggested to fix this including downloading different launchers, and doing a reboot of the phone (several times). Nothing. I need to absolutely need to know when I have emails especially now that I'm taking classes again. Even if it did show a notification, if I opend the email app, it would delete the notfication. This wans't a problem to keep something in notification status on the 6. Fingerprint scanner doesn't work majority of the time. I just look like some idiot stroking my phone. creepy. haha. In addition to about 15 other issues listed about this phone, my app that unlocks my house when I arrive stopped working. Tried everything to fix that. nothing. I thought it was the app. But the minute I switched back to my 6, the app started working again. So, now I believe it's because of the 9. This has been the worse phone I have ever had. I would NOT recommend this phone to anyone!

column1: Ships from AND SOLD BY Amazon
column2: I did not like the curved screen at first. But I ended up really liking it. It really is a beautiful phone. I haven't really messed either the camera yet but the quality looks great. It's a super fast phone. Games run smooth. Call of duty mobile ran great. Pubg ran great.I have never had a phone this big. I even have a bulky case on it but I am used to it. The speakers are real good. Nice and loud. The wifi signal hasn't disconnected yet. The battery is okay. I don't use my brightness all the way. Seems like it drains a little fast. I think the problem here is that background apps are being run. There are a lot open tabs you can forget about too. They do not close automatically.Battery tip : Dont let your battery drop below 40% and dont charge it past 80%. This is called the 40/80 rule. You can look it up yourself to decide.That being all said if you want to make sure you are getting a brand new phone then buy from Amazon directly. "Ships from AND SOLD BY AMAZON." Lots of people on here are unhappy because they buy from 3rd party sellers. If you buy from Amazon directly (assuming you want a brand new phone) the phone is completely brand new and unopened with everything included that was originally suppose to be included. Ebay has this weird thing where vendors will list an item brand new but going into the product details they clearly state it has been opened. Already opened = not brand new.

The speakers, as in call speakers to. Un usuable. To many weird little features that you'd never know or use ever or be able to remember but make the phone more difficult to use then intuitive. The swiping is difficult to open menus and navigate. I feel the service is subpar to. The camera for the cost isn't great at all and it's actually REALLY hard to take pictures with the phone. Even just trying to take simple pictures of skinny things up close it just couldn't deal. The phone was also in rough shape and for the only SLIGHT price break missing everything like the wireless charger phone case screen protector etc was a real bummer. Another HUGE deal breaker was the battery. I don't even game on this phone just social media and I find myself needing to charge the phone 2-3 times A DAY. Over all it feels like this phone was a cash grab on samsungs part and I've used phones 15 years old that feel better then this one. The screen is also soooo hard to use and the phone is difficult to grab. Hate to leave such a harsh review just they really missed the mark with this phone. The screen being nice and bright and high res is offset by the low battery and the bevels that feel like they distort things and give weird reflective effects. Will be returning.

column1: Amazon doesn't tell you in package that the warranty is not a full year
column2: When I called Samasung tech support about the S9+ muffled quality of the phone's microphone (complaints from people I've called), I discovered, from Samsung, there was only 5-months of warranty remaining. The phone is supposed to have a 1-year warranty.Calling Amazon, they now tell me that the warranty began when they took possession of the phone, not when I take possession of the phone. Now, Samsung includes all the warranty information in the packaging, however Amazon doesn't deem it necessary to provide clear-and-full disclosure of this important bit of information. This lack of full disclosure could be extremely expensive. To be clear, you're getting a perfectly new phone from Amazon but...without the full warranty.I am, of course returning the phone. Sad, that I have been very pleased with Amazon for a long time only to discover this lack of clear disclosure in the packaging. I am well aware the phone has a 1-year warranty, but you must dig through the fine print to find this is not true if purchased through Amazon. If your new phone is sitting on a shelf in their warehouse, then your warranty is slowly expiring.After discovering this, I had no interest in trouble shooting a problem with the S9+ micorphone which turns out to NOT be compatible with the new, higher-quality, high-security standard of VoLTE phone calling. With the S9+, you're paying for this feature on this next generation phone -- though Samsungs product, here, is flawed. Samsung's work around is to deactivate your 4G VoLTE feature. This means audio and Video calls are reverted back to the fuzzy dark ages.
