column1: Bought from Amazon, activated with Sprint
column2: I just started using this phone so too early for a definitive review.I am mainly going to address some issues brought up by others since there are a lot of problems people are writing about.One of the big issues with these reviews is that people don't usually include who was the actual seller of the product.As most hopefully realize, just because you buy a product on Amazon doesn't mean it was actually sold by Amazon.Many third party sellers sell through Amazon.This is especially a problem for electronics where there are so many variations in model numbers and "gray market" devices one could end up with an expensive paper weight.I suspect that is the source of many of the issues with this product.Make sure you know the seller.My invoice shows: "Sold by: Amazon Services, Inc." While you may get the correct item from another seller you also could get a lemon without any customer support. Also make sure it specifically states "New" if that is what you want and whether a US Warranty (or the correct warranty for your country) is included.Gray market goods typically don't have a warranty.Also see if the item comes with Amazon support.My Galaxy S9 specifically stated 90 day support from Amazon for any issues.I bought the 128 gb version of the S9 to replace a Galaxy S7 Edge.This is the 4th galaxy device I've had so I am familiar with the setup.Once the device arrived I turned it on and enabled Wif Fi to get it up and running as much as possible.I then used the installed "Smart Switch" software from Samsung to transfer everything from my old phone to the new one.I couldn't get it to work wirelessly but using the cable and included adapter it worked without a hitch.I then attempted to use the sim card from my old phone to get activated on my existing Sprint account.The sim card is in a tray at the top edge of the phone.Use the included tool or paperclip to open the tray.I was unsuccessful in activating through the phone and online. I called Sprint customer service and they attempted to activate from their end.That was also unsuccessful.Likely issue was my old sim card was not compatible. No problem he said just go to a Sprint store and they will get you a new card for about $3.Next day I did just that.The woman who helped me was not familiar with the process of someone bringing in their own phone but with help from the supervisor I got the new card and the phone activated in about 15 minutes.The actual charge: $0!So the answer to the question do these unlocked phones really work is yes. Just make sure you are getting an authentic model (by buying only from a reputable seller), have a little knowledge and get some help from a knowledgeable cell phone network company employee.Other things to note: the S9 uses a "type C" USB cable. This is different from the micro usb cables from the S7 and other models.It is a different size connector and enables "fast charging". One cable is included but you may want to get additional ones for the car or as spares - or get a wireless charging pad. the S9 can use a micro SD card for additional storage.If your current phone has one you can simply install it in the new phone or buy a new one.Couple additional items of note: the home button is now virtual instead of physical. One of the implications of this is the fingerprint sensor is now on the back near the camera lens. I find this to be awkward especially when operating one handed. However you can use facial and iris recognition instead to unlock the phone. You can also choose not to lock when at a specific location however it hasn't worked for me so far.

column1: First Galaxy Phone I Haven't Liked
column2: I've had Samsung Galaxies for years (Galaxy S4, S7, and now S9). The S9 is the first one I haven't been totally satisfied with. At least the specific one I have is glitchy, and it has features I don't like. I wouldn't have chosen the infinity screen (I like to have at least a real back button), and there are other things new to this phone that I don't like. For example, when I want to set something up in my Alexa/WiFi network, I have to use my old Galaxy S7 that I still have to actually get it to work. I've tried over and over to set things up through my S9, but to no avail. Good thing I still have the S7 and can do everything other than call and text via WiFi. I feel like the S9 made no improvements over the S7, and there are definitely things that are worse in my opinion. I sometimes wish I hadn't bought it, but I got a good deal and would have needed a new phone eventually.

column1: Phone freezes, won’t dial out, the antenna weak, callers complain about sound quality, Swipe bad.
column2: The phone does every great, EXCEPT the actual phone part is horrible.I’m probably going to return it.Calls drop every day.It won’t dial out unless I restart it.This happens whether the call is WiFi or via the carrier.This did not happen with my last 6 phones.Same carrier for last 6 phones, but this "Flagship" is a POS WITH A CAPITAL "S".In addition, it does not hold its value.It’s unbelievable to me that a OnePlus will sell on EBay for 95% of its purchase price every 6 months when the new version arrives.But I bought this on Cyber Monday for $547 plus tax with a normal price of $899 and it’s selling on EBay in the 400s!that’s ridiculous drop in value compared to OnePlus.My biggest complaint is failure to dial out.I’ve tried rebooting.I’ve tried resetting everything.I’ve called my carrier.While the camera is exceptional, it FAILS at being a phone!!!!!!UPDATE JAN 24, 2019 - I received a replacement.The replacement had the same defects as the original, PLUS The volume from speakers was lower.It is unworthy to be called a flagship.It looks nice.It has a nice screen.It has a terrific camera.It is a LOUSY phone - it’s main function.It is Filled with Samsung Bloatware.AND the predictive swipe texting on both phones was the worst at predicting words of any phone I’ve ever owned.The keyboard sucks in swipe mode.Horrible.I’m going to OnePlus (no bloatware) or Apple (security and just great products).

column1: It was reset, but locked to AT&T
column2: December 5th, 2021 @ 10:54 PM CDTAfter jumping through hoops with AT&T's terrible customer service representatives and those reps eventually understanding that I don't want to switch service providers and I don't want to be an AT&T customer they finally directed me to the part of their website that allows their customers to request their phone be unlocked.After AT&T verified the phone was paid for, not stolen, and so on they gave me a code to use during set up with my service provider that did allow me to use my preferred service provider.My mom has been happily using her new Galaxy S9 phone for 1 month. It works great. Genuine new phone look, performance, and battery life. The phone came with all the right accessories in a genuine Samsung Galaxy S9 box.So long story short if you don't have time to jump through hoops for a reset but not service unlocked phone then keep looking.But if you do have the time and patience to deal with that then it is a quality product and I highly recommend purchasing it.------------------------------------------October 25, 2021 @ 11:50 PM CDTSo I bought this phone (Samsung Galaxy S9 - 64GB - Coral Blue).I should also mention that I am already a proud owner of a Samsung Galaxy S9 so I can say that physically this (Amazon) phone feels and looks the same as mine, I bought this phone on Amazon to give to my mom.It does have a valid IMEI number and I got Samsung to verify that the device is a legitimate Samsung phone.Now for the problems it is NOT factory unlocked as advertised and rather it is locked to AT&T. I've put in a request on <https://www.att.com/deviceunlock/> and I should know if it can be unlocked.My concern though is the seller lied about it being factory unlocked so was this phone lost, stolen, has past due balance, some other horrible thing in its past I don't know.------------------------------------------I'll update this review after I hear back from AT&T.But needless to say, if AT&T won't unlock the phone then I'll be returning it to Amazon immediately.------------------------------------------

I was SO excited to get my new phone... I opened the Amazon box(in tact) to find a Samsung Galaxy S9 box. The outer sleeve of the box was dented and ripped. First I was disappointed because I did not order a used phone, I ordered a new phone and expected a new looking box. I then took the sleeve off and finished opening the box only to find that there was NO PHONE in the box at all, no phone, no charger, no nothing!!!!! I am so disappointed and furious I could scream. I spent a lot of money on the phone. I called Amazon and the woman told me there was nothing they could do. She told me that they needed to start a 3 day investigation. No reassurance, nothing. They told me to call them back in 3 days. I am guessing they have some internal theft going on?? Not sure what else it would be. I order from Amazon all the time. I rarely have an issue, but this makes me rethink ordering from Amazon, or online at all. Has anyone else had something like this happen???

column1: Nice phone until it stopped charging 3 months in
column2: So if the phone worked I'd give it 4 or 5 stars but not being able to charge by wire is a very big bug apparently not too uncommon for this phone.I can charge it wirelessly, I can connect the phone to my laptop and perform the Samsung Smart Switch backup process, but for some unknown reason it fails to charge through the USB port.Service to Samsung has been above average but its outsourced overseas scripted help - this takes extra time spent try to explain the symptoms and get the desired support.Naturally with a suspect hardware error I now have the undesirable task of shipping the phone to them, waiting for it to be repaired/replaced, and then waiting for the return,From what I'm told that sounds like a two week turnaround.This is a flagship phone.Samsung is a big seller of these phones.Support should be much stronger IMHO - such as accelerated return and repair for such a new phone.Battery life has been good, wifi and bluetooth have been solid and aren't draining my battery, screen look great, find the Bixby button to be in an annoying location often accidentally pressed and then more time wasted to cancel it.Have had no system locks or unexpected reboots unlike my former platform.Wish it did other things that the last phone did such as hands free txt while driving.The email apps I've used thusfar leave desirable room for improvements such as the ability to place email folders at the home screen - less clicks to see stuff.

column1: Great Phone, Switched from Apple to Android
column2: I cracked my iPhone screen and was debating on what upgrade I should get if I stuck with Apple products and decided to start looking up information on comparable android devices. I read reviews on the Galaxy S9 plus and liked what I was reading about what all the phone had and can do. Amazon Prime day just happened to have this phone for sale at a good price and I took the plunge into the Android world. I've now been using the phone for about a week or so and have to say this was an easy switch as there are so many functions on the phone that I wish the iPhone had. I am enjoying learning what this phone is capable of and it's pretty easy to do.The camera is one of my favorite things as it takes very clear pictures.One thing I am not liking is some of the touch functions or how slow things "open", like a picture or comment on Facebook. Not sure if there are options I have to adjust or it's just an issue with that app in general. Overall, I am so far liking what the phone offers and can't say I regret switching.

column1: Camera's glass cover cracked after two 3 days
column2: Wow. After 3 days of using (without a single drop) I've noticed the camera's glass cover is cracked. Next day I am already having dust particles under it. Quick google and I see I am not the only one (there are many). I've noticed this last night after I left a warm building and on the outside it was pretty cold. The funny thing is that many other users with this problem noticed that the temperature difference might be the problem. And yeah, most of them have owned their samsung phones for only few days/weeks too. So it seems like if it doesn't happen to you in few weeks/months after buying then you are safe. I am extremely disappointed. I own old iphone SE, nexus 5 and iphone 4 where the last one is being used by my kid as a toy (!!) and non of these have broken either front glass or camera glass.

column1: Not a Samsung fan, but this is an excellent phone
column2: I needed a new phone and was in the market for a deal. Based on the prioritizing of my needs and wants for this new phone, after much analysis I settled on a low end Samsung S10 (potentially a high end S10e) or a high end S9+. The finals were fought out by S9+ 6GB RAM vs S10e 8GB RAM. In the end the S9+ won out despite less RAM but a much better screen, battery, patch level and procedures point. The price difference for the best price at the moment was about $300. To me saving $300 was worth sacrificing 2GB RAM while also having better screen and battery life.So far, this phone has held up very well. For a sole negative I'd say the camera sometimes act a little glitchy but this, I'm hopeful, will get fixed with a firmware push.

I wish the "Bixby" button on the left side of the phone was either a little higher up or on the other side.I don't use it and it gets in the way when I turn my phone on.I use this phone for texting, e-mails, calls, sometimes facebook.I'm not a frequent picture taker, but the camera is easy to use(saying something for me) and takes good pictures.I put a heavy duty screen shield on it & a pretty good case. Unless I break it, will probably be the last phone I ever buy, as I am a 77 year old grandmother.I still need some tips on muting the phone & turning it back on without going into settings & volume, but will have to check in with my carrier to see if this is even possible.It used to be long ago on an earlier Samsung S model, but things change.Basically well satisfied.

I bought the Samsung Galaxy S9 Like New from Amazon Warehouse Deals and NOT an authorized seller. I wanted an extra $50 off cause someone touched the phone but then returned it. I work in education; I'll take any deal I can get. I also made sure the phone came with original packaging (It was stated in the condition description).So far, I am very pleased with this purchase. The phone is lovely. It came with the plastic still on and all the original pieces such as headphones and the little tools for popping out the sim card. It does not come with a charger so I picked some up in a separate order.I have AT&T. Getting my service sorted was a bit tricky but it is set up and everything is working now. I went to one store and the agent switched the sim card and checked calling service but not my data. I left, I shopped, and then suddenly realized that my internet wasn't working. Went to another store but the agents were useless and only wanted to sell me stuff that was irrelevant to my issue. So it goes. I went home and called AT&T. Three agents and an hour later I rolled a yahtzee and Mark the Advanced Tech guru came on the phone. We did a bunch of stuff on the phone having to do with my IMEI and APN. Neither immediately worked. Finally, he had me hang up and turn my phone off so he could "zap it." He called me back after, cause that's the kind of class act Mark is. Huzzah! My mobile data was working without issue.One disadvantage of buying the phone Like New is that the warranty was started by the person who first bought it. It does not say anywhere in the Amazon description when the phone was first purchased. I registered the phone with my Samsung account and it shows that the warranty started in June. I am therefore assuming that's when the first owner registered it. It is beginning of Dec. now. If I anticipated really using the warranty (I don't) I might find this annoying.I'll also point out that I bought this phone with my Discover during an Amazon cashback quarter. The 5% cashback covered my state tax. This saved me an extra $30 that I put toward a microsd card for more storage.If anything goes wrong with this phone, I will update in the future. So far, I am tickled lilac with my Like New Amazon Warehouse Deals phone.

column1: I was skeptical but it's working out fine!
column2: The reviews made me very nervous, so I watched MANY YouTube videos on how to spot a fake phone lol.To be honest the only sketchy thing was the box- it definitely was not in the original box and it didn't have a product sticker on the box.All the contents in the box though...look legit.So far this phone has been working well for me the past few days.It was easy to switch my info from my iPhone SE, and update my existing Verizon line.No hiccups in the process!The only issue I have been having is connecting to my Honda Bluetooth...but I think that may be more of an Android/Samsung issue overall based on reviews I've read.The photo is great and it works for my needs.Upon inspecting the manufacture warranty, it shows that the phone warranty expires in December 2019 (which is less than a year from now).So, I put in a ticket with Samsung to see if my warranty date can be modified since I just got the phone, hopefully they will honor my request.But the phone seems legit! It is in Samsung's database and compatible with Verizon.Should anything change about how it works- I'll be sure to add it to this review.*Update*-Samsung updated my manufacture warranty to July 2020 :-)-I think I need to use the MirrorLink app to use my phone in my car.I am contacting Samsung support on how to do this since the YouTube videos are confusing.*Update #2*I realized the reason why my bluetooth wasn't linking to my Honda was because I had too many devices linked lol oops...So Bluetooth works perfectly now and the MirrorLink works as well.COMPLETELY SATISFIED with this product right now.

column1: High Quality Product, but Not as Advertised
column2: I bought this phone when it was on sale. The webpage said I bought the phone from burnt circuit. Well, why is it that I bought a new unlocked phone and was sent a phone that was Verizon locked and had missing equipment in the box? The box wasn't sealed, and the akg headphones that come standard with every galaxy s9/s9+ were lacking the AKG logo found on every pair of their headphones.There was no SIM card remover, nor any adapters for transferring data from an old phone to this new phone. I verified that this was in fact a real galaxy s9 by looking up the IMEI number and doing a test using CPU-Z. I'm giving this a 3 star review because, while I got a real phone, it was not a new phone nor was it unlocked like I paid for.

column1: Works Great After Being Submerged in Water 11 Days
column2: This is a miracle phone. I slipped on the ice in Lake Huron in Mackinaw City and the phone fell through a crack. The ice was so thick that we couldn’t break it to get it out. At the time, the water was 34 degrees and I figured it was a lost cause. I was passing by 11 days later and thought I would check to see if I could find it (with no real expectation of finding it). Fortunately, there hadn’t been any strong waves and the phone was laying face down in the water, right where I fell. I stood it up against a baseboard heater for about 12 hours. I then stood it up on a paper towel (in a cupboard so I wouldn’t be tempted to plug it in) at room temp for about 60 hours. I charged it and it worked perfectly.I would recommend this phone to anyone who was accident prone.It has takes great photos, has ample storage, and rarely has any glitches.

Some of the reviews had made me nervous but it isn't scratched, used, or missing all together. It even has the SmartSwitch paperwork, user guide, health warnings, and extra ear bud caps (still sealed). My only complaint isn't with the phone, but with the delivery person. They left it in my back yard for some reason, so my dog chewed into the cardboard Amazon box and put some deep gouges in the external S9 sleeve. But nothing important was damaged.

column1: Poor battery - Not charging anymore and out of warranty in 3 Months
column2: Purchased my S9+ on February 22nd / 2019(on productdescribed with "US WARRANTY) A month after acquiring it I started to notice that battery was draining to 50% after 4 hours without even making / receiving a call and Data set to off... I didnt pay too much attention to it as by that time this was just my backup phone. This week my phone stopped charging at all.To my surprise when I went to the samsung website to request service on it, I got a message saying "Manufacturer Warranty Expired on Sunday, June 9, 2019*"(I had registered my device the same day I received it)..To make the story short, Samsung is only offering a 3 months warranty on a $400 phone. I guess I will never ever use a Samsung phone again

This phone was great the first two months I had it. After that, my screen, my apps, everything would started to freeze more often than usual. It just got to the point when I closed out, my entire phone went black and wouldn't let me back in the phone. This doesn't seem normal anymore and it hasn't fallen or anything. No sorts of damage or anything.So I dont understand why its doing this. If you do, let me know. I spent almost $800 and that's a arm and leg for me.

column1: Not as listed and not completely functional
column2: I bought this phone for my son who lives in the Dominican Republic. While I expected a few cosmetic issues, I was not expecting any operational issues. I tested most of the critical features before leaving the United States, however one I overlooked was the SD card slot. When the SD card was inserted (in the DR), the phone did not recognize it. Additionally, this was supposed to be a factory unlocked phone, however when I received it... it was actually a unlocked AT&T phone. I dont know what other issues may arise as it was a last minute purchase, but I hope the SD card reader will be the only operational issue we run into.Because my son needed another phone, I did not bring it back with me to return to celltraders. Overall, I guess for the price I cant complain to much... but I will never buy another "Fully Tested" or any other phone from this seller again.

column1: Easy To Get Up and Running
column2: My Nexus 6P died - no new battery would revive it - so I ordered a Galaxy S9 with 128GB. It arrived a couple of days later. I charged it fully, then connected to my wireless router. The phone automatically prompted me to update the android software and restore apps & contacts from the google backup. Then I removed the SIM card from the Nexus and put it in the Galaxy. I have Straight Talk. The phone said it needed to restart to incorporate the SIM card. After rebooting I had regular voice calling and voicemail service available. It couldn't have been easier.

I recommend RS CELLS as seller to buy from.I was a little nervous as to how ‘used’ it would look. But it looked new. I think it’s new! No original box or manual or anything else aside from the phone and original charger as described by seller. Popped in my SIM after cutting it down to size.All my contacts were there.All texts gone. Had problem sending multimedia text message but looked online to solve problem (APN related).I haven’t explored everything on phone yet.So far no major problems yet, knock on wood.I’m glad I took a chance to update my old phone and buying from good seller.Paid 1/2 the price, new, win-win.

column1: Excellent quality camera and good battery life
column2: I got this phone during a Cyber Monday Sale. Considering the reduced cost and the extra Amazon device included with the package this was a fantastic deal! Buying from Amazon also gave me a peace of mind. Should something go wrong then I have a path of recourse.The phone was new, factory sealed, and unlocked. It fired up right away. Getting it work with Mint Mobile was a little challenging but that's not the phone's fault. The camera is excellent, especially if you shoot in RAW/DNG format and process the image with something like Capture One or Lightroom. Battery life is also great but I also don't use the phone 24/7 non-stop.
Great phone, loving it.

column1: Updates are slow to get on unlock phones
column2: Bought this phone to replace an iPhone 7. Wife likes the phone but coming from the simplicity of the iOS, this is a little more complicated. She has since gotten used to it but still struggles with advance settings.The reason for the 3 stars is it is an unlocked phones and unlocked phones do not get updates quickly. the so o. Carrier locked phones have already upgraded to the Pie and One UI updates but no word on when the unlocked phones will get theirs. Samsung need to step up their customer service game.

column1: Received a genuine S9+ when ordered
column2: I got the S9+ 64 GB coral blue version on prime day when the price was ~480 with tax. I was really looking at One Plus 7, but at this price, it was a no brainer for me. Six months on I have had no issues. The phone came sealed, but then I ordered it from Amazon and not any third party seller. The serial number checked out that it was a US version and I have not had any major complaints.Now for the pros and cons of the phone itself:Pros:Fingerprint unlock is good and I use secure fingerprint unlock for all my appsIt has find my phone and I tested that it worksAlmost full screen to body ratio with no weird punch holes, notches etc ( One main reason I was hesitant with S10 ). This makes the phone gorgeous to look a, in my opinion.6GB of Ram makes things really smooth.Sound has improved a lot and the Dolby atmos mode is amazingCons:Face unlock/ Iris unlock is a gimmick and does not work smoothly. I use fingerprint always.Battery life is 1 ~ 2 days. Its the same across all phones, so its not really a complaint.Fast charging takes 2 hours for full charge.Phone is slightly on the heavier side for what I prefer.Low light photography is better than earlier generations but its not a pixel.It will get updated to Android 10 (yaay) but after S10 gets the update (Oh :( )

column1: Amazed at all the added features
column2: Upgraded from galaxy S3 I bought new in 2012.So you know I'm feeling it.Amazed at all the added features.I'm still learning the features

Edge Cellular sent me my S9+, and it was cracked. They paid shipping back, and replaced it. The second one had a really bad screen burn. Neither phone fit within the description I read and purchased, and thus Im returning the second one for a full refund. This time I have to pay shipping and wait for one from another company arrive. All I've gotten from this company is losing whatever return shipping costs, a week of my time, and a little stress. Not worth it.

The exterior of the phone is pretty scratched up especially around the corners from being dropped by the previous owner, phone wasn't able to read my sim card, and there were 2 long streaks running down the screen and a bunch of icons that were burnt into the screen (the visibility becomes more prominent as the screen gets lighter). Besides that everything else like camera and audio was working fine.I gave a 2 star review because I was able to return and get a refund in a timely manner

column1: Worked for a few months then screen went black
column2: I loved this phone when I bought it but then after 5 months of using it the screen started flickering with green lines out of no where and then went completely black with one green line on the top! I didn't damage drop or even get it wet. I messaged the sellers and they weren't helpful at all saying everything worked when they sent it... ridiculous

column1: Buy from the manufacturer if possible!
column2: I purchased this phone as a gift for my husband having bought the same directly from Samsung last year for myself. Less than 10 days after the phone arrived, Amazon lowered the price by $40 but refused to make a price adjustment. Believe me, if I had read the customer reviews regarding poor customer support, reconditioned phones sold as new and a slew of other problems, I would never have made this purchase. I guess I should be happy that I received a new factory unlocked phone that is living up to expectations!

column1: Beware carrier features will not work on unlocked phones.
column2: Buyer beware. Unlocked phones do not support some carrier features like video calling and wifi calling. I bought this s9 plus to use on Verizon wireless and these features are blocked. The reason they are blocked is because it's an unlocked phone and Verizon wants you to spend the big bucks buying the phone from them to use all the features the phone supports. It BS really but that's just how it is. So if you buy this or any unlocked phone then you can expect some of the features not to work. I warned you.

This was the best decision ever to buy this phone. The phone came in its original box with all the accessories. I turn the phone on it worked perfectly. I have metro pcs as my carrier, I try to put my old SIM card in the phone it didn’t work. I went to the metro pcs store, all i had to do was register the phone and get a new SIM card. I got to keep my old number, I was in that store for like 5 minutes awesome buy.

column1: A fall of a height of 30 cm the screen was crushed
column2: I had a Blu Life One X2 for several years and the phone stopped operating because of its battery, so I decided to buy a Samsung S9 thanks to its features. I put a good protector to avoid damage by blows, however it turned out to be useless since with a fall of a height of 30 cm the screen was crushed. My previous Blu-branded phone, fell a lot of times of much higher heights and never broke the screen. I think it's a scam that a high-end phone such as the Samsung S9, with a fall of 30 cm is broken. I'm very disappointed.

Battery life, audio output jack, and thunderbolt on this phone is what let me down.I found this phone over 8.3 hoursidle and about 1.7 hours actual use dropped it to 68% I paid attention to it and tried to reduce it withlower settings. it looks fine maybe if you limit yourself to 8 apps but then you got bloatware (unwanted apps that won't uninstall). so overall I rate this phone a 4.2 out of 5, Don't think the S10 is looking any better besides very little features that give it an advantage, making the S9 a better choice in pricing over bells and whistle S10.

I'm a Samsung cell girl, and always will be.They're technology is way outbefore competitors.I've been using Samsung since the galaxy s3.. This one is the sleekest one I've owned.I love the color, features, everything.when the s10 came out I said no way! u can see the front cameras in the screen's way, where as mine in on top tiny black margin barely an obstacle.It's a bit heavier than my previous ones, but it is glass backing and larger cell.I'm happy and I've owned it for more than a year

column1: Perfect Bundle! all you need is there
column2: Perfect Bundle! all you need is there, I love the quality for the product and presentation. It's working great for a local mobile company in Argentina.

I purchased this phone to use with my Verizon plan. Since purchasing, I've traveled out of the US to Canada and Mexico and the phone has not worked internationally either time. Verizon support finally said that this phone does not have the same features as a Verizon model phone, so global data roaming will not work. I was under the impression that this phone would work fully with any carrier as it is an unlocked device.

This is exactly what I wanted in a phone. It arrived in a very timely fashion and works as I would have hoped. I had the S9+ previous to this and I don't miss any of the additional features that come with the S9+. This phone was much less expensive and definitely worth the money.It arrived with some minor scratches on the screen but in perfect working order.

I have had this phone for a few months now ,and I love it. I recently switched from an iphone 6 to this phone so that I would have better picture quality. I did not want to break the bank buying an iphone X, so I found this phone for an amazing price instead. Even though this phone is a Verizon wireless phone, I was able to use it with my AT&T plan. I am very impressed with the battery life! The only thing that sucks about an android is I cannot text through WiFi when I don't have have cell signal like I could with my iphone. I would buy from this seller again.

Wow, what a huge step up from my Galaxy S7 Edge. All day battery, even with hours of screen time. Apps load quickly and run smoothly. Firefox loads web pages quickly.The camera opens quickly, and takes picture quickly. My old S7 would sometimes take several tries to open the camera and then take up to 10-15 seconds before it was ready to take a picture and longer for a video.Pictures are definitly much better than my old S7 Edge.All in all a nice upgrade.

column1: Excellent Used-Like New Phone But  With Insurance Problems
column2: First let me say that the Galaxy S9+ is a big beautiful phone. The screen is outstanding, the speed is fast and it has more features than I ever probably learn to use. Definitely a first-class phone from Samsung.What I really want to say is: I purchased this Galaxy S9+ from the Amazon Warehouse at great price with an additional 20% discount. I was concerned about purchasing a Used-Like New phone but my son, who had previously worked at Amazon, said those phones were in new condition and a great buy. He was right.The phone was without a scratch and had a clean esn. It came in the original box ( a little beat up) with all the original accessories still wrapped up. Activation was no problem and it is working great. And it was half the price of a new phone! Half price for a Galaxy S9+! I am so happy and will recommend to my friends who are shopping for new phones to check out the Amazon warehouse deals.UPDATE: I am taking off one star because I cannot get insurance on phone. Amazon will not provide nor even offer insurance on own product. There are two insurance providers on Amazon, SquareTrade and Asurion, but neither will cover used Amazon phone. Interestingly, the both cover used eB*y phones but Amazon can't or won't get them to cover their used products. Go figure???

column1: Good phone for Prime members, saved money
column2: Good price for Amazon prime users. Also TV is great. One thing, BUY A GOOD PROTECTOR !! Also buy as much memory as possible so as too send photos too. Fast phone and lots of apps. Dont pay for iPhone, the $$$$$ is too high. Great pics and Amazon app to send pics to computer is a great addition. As a old fart it took me time to look at all the apps. Oh, get a good security program too. Well worth the $$ for Amazon prime members, mine was un-locked. Just a footnote, most ISP will have free downloads for security programs, YES, for the phone also

column1: Was shipped a broken phone and then they never refunded me
column2: I bought this, because they said the phone would be unlocked and work with Verizon, but when I tried to connect to Verizon it wouldn't work. I then returned it and they haven't refunded me. I would not recommend buying from them as I am not the only one who has had this issue.

Love it! I am happy I selected the Galaxy S9 as my new phone. Start up was super fast. There are so may options on this phone you can really personalize it. With fingerprint and facial recognition no one can get into your phone and make changes. Pictures are great with wonderful color and imaging. Easy to share photos on many platforms. I have only had my phone for a few weeks but I keep finding new things to make changes and adjust setting so it is truly MY phone. Lots of Apps and Widgets to access both from Samsung and Play Store.

column1: Great phone, but fragile camera glass
column2: I bought this phone at the end of last summer. Like all my phones, I immediately put it in a case. It has served me very well and continues to do so but like many others (I have just now realized via a short internet search) my camera screen is now broken. I reached in my pocket a few days ago but felt something off. The glass that covered my camera was shattered. It look like a small bullet or something shot it though there was nothing else in my pocket to have done so.The Big Con:The primary reason I bought this phone was as an upgrade to it's camera capabilities. With the lens gone, I currently have a piece of clear tape over where the glass used to be however that makes it hard to take pictures as you can imagine.This seems a major flaw in the phone and as far as I've been able to understand from samsung.com that because it is physical damage it is not covered under the one year warranty.I teach high school science and we are currently under strict quarantine in the state I'm in. As our schools quickly adopted an online format I was hoping to start using my phone to record videos of me to stay in touch with my students as there's more versatility on it compared to my school-loaned Chromebook. Sadly I'm not sure what to do next outside of buying a new phone.The Pros:Outside of the issue I am facing, the phone works well as a typical smart phone. With the camera covered up I'm not too worried about dust making it's way into the phone and it is still functioning as a smart phone just fine.I can access my school emails quickly and successfully, it's awesome at surfing the web, and 64 GB of storage sure beats the 32 I had on my previous phone.I play a handful of games on my phone. They all run smoothly and I don't believe I've encountered any moments where my phone has crashed due to activity.I love the phone but I can't help but be heartbroken at the moment.I would highly recommend the phone to anyone who does not mind the high-than-normal risk of losing your main camera capabilities the way I did. At least I still have the front facing camera...

column1: ... it as a gift to my sister and she love him!
column2: I bought it as a gift to my sister and she love him!
The best Galaxy yet!!! You have to see it to believe it..... The coral blue is stunning!!!

Christmas present to myself. I was loving it until the fingerprint scanner quit working yesterday. Should've known when i recieved the phone with the back panel not closed completely.It wouldn't stick but I figured having a thick case would protect it.I had it turned off and when I turn the phone back on it froze during startup. I figured out how to restart it, but now the fingerprint scanner doesn't work. And that is what I was loving the most since I had all my apps using the fingerprint as login. I've never been prejudiced against used products but this will make me think twice. Very disappointing!

column1: Product looked\functioned great - Unable to register for warranty.
column2: I purchased this Amazon warehouse purchase because I could not bring myself to pay full price for todays high end smartphones.After looking at the product I received it looks and functions as new.I am deducting two stars because I tried to register the phone for warranty service to find that it couldn't be registered.So I'm pulling one star for amazon listing it as having a US warranty, and one star from Samsung for not being able to register the product.I will continue to test the functionality of this phone in the coming week.Great value for the money if Samsung supports the product as advertised.

I love my new phone. It is the right size and easy to handle for my smaller hands. I enjoy using the "swipe" feature on this phone as it can be done with one hand. The phone is very responsive. I haven't had it long enough to learn all the features, but so far, it has worked wonderfully and met my expectations.

All of a sudden my phone has issues staying connected online whether it is using wi-fi or not. ALSO - the screen freezes and the touch screen will not work. Apps will not load... should I go on? I JUST got the phone in December. It is only 4 months old. Funny how the support expired 3 weeks ago, too. DO NOT BUY THIS!

column1: Best samsung so far and will be for a while
column2: I got the regular S9 with 128gb. The screen is curved and it is real fun to watch to videos on phone. The sound quality is amazing. Its powerful enough like some of the portable speakers. Beats iphone any day. Camera is fabulous. Pictures are crystal clear and true HD.Some drawbacks - Pictures take lot of storage space. I installed a sd card. But its wierd - sometimes the pictures go to card and sometimes on phone. Very random.Another point to be noted is that since it is curved screen so you have to be very careful in selecting the cover/case else you will crack the screen on first fall.Otherwise, the phone is slim and sleek. Real stylish.

column1: Is it possible to change other models?
column2: BodyI am very disappointed with this mobile phone.First of all, in the United States even the network signal is so bad that a lot of software can not be used.Second, cell phone battery life is very shortThe first few days of receipt can only last one day.It is not a month, full of electricity can only be used during the day.Disappointing.

I've always used cheap off brand smart phones and I'm not one who buys the latest and greatest every year, but I did break down and buy this last year when it was still a new product. There is definitely a difference between a budget phone and a top of the line Samsung. I was only worried because the last Samsung I had didn't last very long even though I took good care of it, but this one is still alive a strong after owning it as long as I have.

column1: Phone transfer non functional, features removed.
column2: Samsung has removed the built in android transfer option. Setting up this phone and transferring your data and settings is infuriating. Considering returning the phone as this is arduous. The promises from samsung that their smart switch application will work with any android 4.1 or later phone is plainly false as the application is incompatable with my android 7.0 phone.Bixby is an annoyance that should be completely removed; google assistant already does a better job.Overall, this phone is nothing but an infuriating attempt for samsung to enforce brand loyalty by making ti painful to move to or from a galaxy device.

column1: Vendor messed up the order twice
column2: Note, when you purchase this product the name beneath the title of the product is the manufacturer name NOT the vendor! Not only was the phone I received different than the one I ordered but they also did not include a charging cable with the product. Don't let them fool you, these phones are NOT new, and they are NOT being sold by Samsung. Do yourself a favor and just go to Best Buy instead.

6 months into owning the phone and the finger print scanner doesnt work well. Now a year later and the phone will randomly tell me there is no sim card entered. I turn the phone off and turn it back on and everything is back to normal. Ive been told my problems will only increase now that this is happening however i am past the window of opportunity for help with this phone so im stuck with it. I will not be buying another refurb from amazon.

bought this for my wife to replace her s6-active. we always buy last years model or even older to save money and own our phones outright. everything about this phone is great but intensive use will drain the battery pretty far down by the end of the day. she doesnt use the finger print or facial security. we dont use our phones for banking, internet shopping,or stuff that could compromise anything we need security for.

I ordered the Samsung Galaxy S9 Unlocked Smartphone for my wife, she simply loves it.It has so many smart features and all the technology you come to expect in a "Smart Phone."It takes great pictures and with 64GB you can download countless, pics, contacts, etc.

I thought I would try to waterfall my old S8+ to my wife and pick up the S9+ from Amazon instead of going through my provider.I ordered it with the SquareTrade plan.That was easy.The phone arrived in the expected time, I transferred the SIM, used the provided data transfer cable and performed the copy form old phone process.I was up and running in minutes!!!I also ordered a case to go with it.The unit performs flawlessly!!!I'm stoked.

I was under the impression, based on your description, that the Samsung Galaxy S9 Plus that I purchased was unlocked and was a Dual Sim Card phone.Unfortunately, the unit that I received had to be unlocked locally and it only had one (1) Sim Card slot.

column1: This phone is everything they say and more.
column2: This phone is everything they say and more. Still learning all of it but not a hint of a problem

Not gonna lie, I was extremely skeptical buying this phone I’ve never bought an android off of Amazon but I got it and I was surprised. It came dead so I jumped because usually it comes with some sort of power but when I charged itIt moved so smooth. I’m not saying to go ahead and buy it after reading my review but weighing the pros and cons it was worth it for me

column1: Many great features removed. fast, great sound & memory. Hate Bixby, curved screen & sealed battery.
column2: So different from previous models. Removed many of the options i need and loved.Sad.I needed more internal memory. Almost left galaxy after many years due to curved infinity screen and silly edge. Bixby is useless.I was advised by many techs not to purchase this model.I finally decided based on slo mo, avitar & more memory.iPhones are more sturdy & have better batteries but no micro sd card!When galaxy removes sd card i'll leave them for iPhone as I can no longer replace batteries in galaxy. Why galaxy? Praying battery lasts.Very complex phone with long learning curve. Too many options! Hate curved infinity screen, bixby & edge. Useless waste!64 gb memory is great so far. Once you buy alexa you need so much more internal memory.Not sure how long battery will last. Crossing my fingers since it can't be replaced.Why on earth did they use curved infinity screen? Very hard to find case and screen protectors that work.Phone is so fragile.What is value and purposeof "bixby"? Also find "edge"useless and unnecessary.Great stereo sound on movies.Still learning phone hidden tricks after many weeks! Learning curve takes forever.Will test with camera soon and get back to you. I loved the s4 and s5 cameras. Why less Mp now on this model?

Love love love love my phone but my only complaint is that is the battery life is trash. It's charges super fast but 30 Mins after its off the charger it's in 75 percent!How? Please get a better battery. Never had this issue with my j7 prime!!!

column1: You won't get what you order, and not unlocked.
column2: Don't bother ordering this. I ordered this phone in February worked great but screen was cracked. Returned it. Just ordered it again, guaranteed it was a verizon unlocked phone. It is not Verizon or unlocked. I got an AT&T phone that will not work with Straight talk.I am beyond pissed off!

column1: S9+ Very Short Battery Life and Buggy...
column2: I am not a heavy phone user. I occasionally surf the internet, text and take a few photos. The battery drains quickly. It has never lasted a day, even though the phone isn't in constant use.The Pie update is buggy and missing features. I am a few days outside the return window, so I wasted my money on this phone. I am going to purchase something else. I am very disappointed.
THIS IS THE CHEAPEST WAY YOU CAN BUY THE PHONE. NEW .....DONT BUY IT REFERBIUSHED ITS A WASTE OF MONEY.

GREAT BUNDLE!
DELIVERED FAST. BEAUTIFUL PURPLE!!! LOVE IT!

came in perfect condition. Transferred my At&t sim from my S7 over before first boot up. Recognized sim card no issues there. It did have to do 5 software updates in a row later on in the day. Sitting on the shelf for a couple years will do that. Camera quality is good, sound and video quality as well. 5 Stars

I am soo glad that I looked at phones long enough to find this one. I was advertised as "very good condition" ...it is in excellent condition! I really do appreciate your honesty, a great phone and AWESOME fast shipping. I recieved it today(Thursday) and was blown away! It was scheduled to be at least 4 days from now. I am very impressed and highly recommend you to anyone else!

I had a Galaxy S4 for several years. It was suitable and did the job. . . mostly. I was having some battery issues and my phone wouldn't update past Android 4.4. I was running into apps that needed a newer version of Android. I could have bought something cheap but I decided to treat myself and found the blue Galaxy S9 on sale for a decent price. I have to say I'm loving this phone.The 5.8" Quad HD+ Super AMOLED screen is GLORIOUS! I run this is high performance mode with the brightness cranked up. Games, movies, even YouTube and TikTok videos look amazing. The curved edge I worried might be distracting but honestly I only notice in a couple games.Sound is really good for a cell phone it has stereo speakers. Volume is more than enough.Performance from the Octa-Core processor and 4GB of ram have not struggled to run anything I've thrown at it.The camera is great. Maybe struggling a little in very bright light with a light colored subject. Otherwise, night mode gives great low light results. Video shooting is very nice with great slow motion results and a nearly unique superslow-motion recording mode at a mind boggling 960 frames per second is a lot of fun to mess around with.Battery life is good, I got most of a day is high performance mode and could easily extend it by cutting things back to save battery.The fingerprint sensor is quick to unlock and easy to use. A trick I found online to improve performance of the fingerprint sensor is to register the same finger more than once. It really works like a charm.The look is sleek and sophisticated though I'm protecting that glassbody with a nice Otterbox Symmetry case. The only real minor negative to the whole thing is this weighs more and is larger than my S4, a little hard on my hands and pocket but really, it's worth it.I can't express how happy I am with this phone. I'm even buying props and things to use in creative videos and photo shoots.

My only complaint with this phone is the curved edge screen. Makes it very easy to crack, mine cracked within a month of owning it. Previously my S5 lasted over 3 years without ever cracking.The curved edge also makes it difficult to select buttons at the edges of a screen and very difficult to scroll sometimes.

Probably the best phone I've purchased in a long time. Would definitely recommend to someone looking for an upgrade, especially if they don't want to pay more for similar performance on something like, say, the iPhone X. I almost bought an iPhone, and after looking at them both I decided to go with the S9 and I am glad I did. The display is pretty awesome, nice colors, and the storage capacity is great, as well as the added benefit of adding an sd card for extra memory. The speed of the phone is high, even if you have a lot of apps open, probably due to the 4 gb ram. Superb performance overall. Impressed me for sure.
Excellent quality and functions as indicated.

column1: The n is that my phone works with boost and that was very Important to me.
column2: Yea i got the s9 very happy with my new phone
Wow, what a phone! Everything is instant: web pages, apps, taking pix. Battery lasts a long time, screen is amazing... just click "Buy", you'll be so glad you did.

column1: What can I say but like a lot,
column2: still learning about it and getting it set up fully. only problem I had was with straight talk. took 4 days for me to finally get it online. Taking a new out of the box unlocked phone to straight talk can be confusing if you try to do it with computer or AI. call during their open hours and get a real person.

Not sure why some people go on and on about android's instead of iPhone's. I still like my iPhone better. I put an SD card in when I got this. For some unknown reason this junk phone says it's not in there anymore. All the movies I had stored on there are GONE. Total joke. Going to get another iPhone now. Thanks.

I bought this phone and I am traveling internationally. The phone says unlocked, but when I tried to use the phone with a India SIM card, it didnt work. When I called Samsung Customer service, they say that this version is US only. There is something called Region lock and I am still struggling to figure out how to make it work in India. I am really frustrated spending so much a phone and doesnt work.

I buy unlocked phones and I've always liked galaxy.I try to stay a year or 2 behind as I'm not paying through the nose for a latest and greatest phone.I like this one.I don't like that you can no longer replace the battery yourself (or have a backup one) but the life is pretty good on it.
Todo me llegó muy bien les recomiendo este producto

I was initially skeptical about buying the s9+ from Amazon, especially after reading most reviews here. It's now about a month since I got it and I love it. It shipped in about two days and came with all accessories as described. It charges very fast and could go about 24hrs without recharging ( I am not a frequent phone user). I would recommend buying directly from Amazon.

Best phone I ever had. Fast, great camera, love the selfie camera feature to wave your hand to take a photo (no more reaching to take a selfie). Can play games on it for hours, use as GPS and connect to Alexa auto all day, text and phone call and still have about 30-40% battery at the end of the day. Can't say enough about this phone.
Great phone, great price.

column1: I like the phone it's a nice change.
column2: I've been an iPhone user for 12 years and this is my first Samsung so it's taking a little getting used to.Ive been spoiled by having a phone that flawlessly synced with my Mac.However I'm digging the extended battery life, the camera clarity, the screens resolution adjustability, the expandable memoryand things like that which have made the switch pleasant.The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is the price and the lack of USB audio play through car audio systems.Even with Black Friday pricing the S9 isn't really competitive in the price department.For unknown reasons Samsung did away with the simple plug and play USB audio.There is a Mirror Link app on the phone for using USB audio only a few cars have that capability.

This was a replacement for my 5 year old Blackberry. I have used Blackberry phones for 15 years, so the transition was challenging and at first it seemed as if I had made the wrong choice. But, after successfully transferring all of my files and apps to the Galaxy and setting up the new apps, it was easy to transition to a new way of doing things. I love it now, but I have to admit I like the physical keyboard better, but Gboard is not bad. P.S. I share membership in the Greatest Generation.
Samsung galaxy s9+ unlocked can work with Claro PR but for the Internet you have to change or add the APN to use it. I love this phone!

I bought phone for my wife and was unhappy to say it was faulty. I didn't have a problem with the tiny scratch in the screen. I did however have a problem with the Black Screen of Death that would appear if you pressed the power button twice in quick succession. I was left with a black screen that had lights on top, and I could feel the home button vibrate if I pressed it, but I could not sign in because I could not see the passcode. I would have to hard reset the phone. Sad, really sad. Don't sell these damaged products NYC Un-reliable.

I was skeptical about purchasing a pho e that was used. Now that I received my phone, I feel so much better.It arrived quickly,much faster than expected.Came in a plain box with different color plug and charger. Not a big problem. Although the description was described as very good, the phone was in almost new condition. There was only one very tiny scratch that is only noticeable if you are really looking for it.Easy to set up for basic use. I still have to figure out all the new to me features on this phone. Its bigger than my old phone, so getting into my wallet is a tight squeeze. Still, not a big problem.The only thing that prevented me from giving this supplier 5 stars was 2 things.1) It came pre-installed with two Canadian apps that I can't remove from the phone. Im in the U.S.A.. I just disabled them. Still able to use everything else.2) One side of the phone was smudged with dirt, as if it was in a case. With all this Covid-19 crap going around. The supplier could have at least wiped it down. I ended up wiping it down with a disinfectant wipe. Problem solved.My complaints aren't major and I'm very excited to use my very pretty ( purple ) phone!!!

Started off great but quickly turned for the worst.First galaxy phone and it lasted about 5 months before randomly turning off and on and blinking repeatedly. Then a few days later it gets locked on the loadingscreen to which it is permanently stuck until I find a work around or hard reset and lose all my items that aren't backed up which is my life.

While some like verbal requests & commands to their phones, I don't.While I love the phone in most respects for its smart engineering, I think it a terrible waste of exterior phone 'real estate', wasting a button for Bixby, Samsung's version of Alexa.For this, 4 stars, not 5.

column1: the color on outer shell is peeling off
column2: The color on outer edges is peeling, sound quality is poor, Pics are good, hard to change keyboardsMain thing is the color on the phone and sound from, improved speakers? I have always used samsung and am disappointed with quality of this one. I have had this for 1 month and 9 days. Great, not

Much better than my old phone and easy to transfer my information over...mostly. My only complaint is the trace amount of screen burn present. On a light colored screen, especially white, I can see the ghost image of the keyboard and home buttons on the screen. Minor annoyance. Otherwise I love this phone!!!

Samsung "as always" takes you above and beyond, I'm impressed with the quality of the phone and the many services that are designed to make you feel comfortable and connected. As for Bixby, I like Google assistant more, but it is good to have both services in one phone. I'm planning to leave the US and I'm not sure that the phone would be OK or locked for US providers only.

Came perfect, well shipped and in original manufacturers packaging. I just had to take the sim card from my previous (Windows) phone and insert it into the S9+ holder. Configuration was very easy, I was new to this but I was 100% successful.

Overall - The phone works well with the exception of the Wifi disconnecting every so often. I have read through the recommended solutions online by resetting the network setting and power cycling the phone. None of these solutions have worked and as far as my research has gone - Samsung is unable to come up with a solution to this defect.Luckily I have enough data to get me through these disconnects.. However, it's disappointing.

column1: ordered from Amazon, received new phone (not refurbished), works with Verizon.
column2: I was concerned about ordering the unlocked s9 after reading several mixed reviews on whether or not this was compatible with Verizon and some people saying they recieved refurbished or defective phones.After more research and a nice sale price I took a bit of a chance and pulled the trigger.Glad I did.Received the phone in perfectly new condition and no issues on Verizon network at all.I just popped in my sim and it's worked perfectly since.Coming from an S8, the S9 is almost identical....with some notable improvements.But I'm not going to turn this into an S9 product review.If you're looking here for an unlocked phone to purchase, you already know if you like the S9 or not.Anyway, I got a good quality, new phone at a much better price than I could have got direct from V, BB, or most other stores (unless you want to lock yourself in with a carrier for two years).

Love the Samsung software and I'm so glad that I purchased the 9+ for best battery, rather than the 9.My phone performs perfectly, much better than the S5 it replaced.Performance on my loaded phone is incredibly fast and responsive.It was a huge dollar investment, but I have zero reqrets or reservations.Beautiful phone. More than 5 stars!

This phone was purchased for my mom. She's had a flip lg phone for the longest time. She never wanted a smart phone. Her phone started giving her problems, so I purchased this one for her. Now I don't think she will ever go back lol. She loves everything about it once she had everyone figured out. Now she's on it more than I am! I would highly recommend this phone to anyone looking for alot of storage and great camera features. It's the perfect size too. Not too big and not too small. She loves it! I'm actually planning on getting the same one!
I Love this phone.
Muy buen celular
Love it Excelent

I wanted to use Tracfone and they sent me a SIM card which would not work in my area. In fact they sent me 3 SIM cards. I went back to my old phone. Since I didn’t keep it I didn’t try out the phone I don’t know about the pictures, Fingerprint reader or battery life.

The 1st phone I received was still locked so I got in touch with customer service and they sent me a prepaid label to send it back and then sent me another phone that was unlocked. The customer service was excellent and I'm happy with my phone.

column1: Not an original unlocked phone, but functionally the same.
column2: I bought this "used, very good" from SikkSound, and it seems to be in what i'd consider very good condition. It's NOT a G965UZKAXAA (which is ordered unlocked direct from Samsung), but it IS a G965U1 (totally unlocked) so it functions exactly the same as one that's ordered unlocked from Samsung. Mine is originally a G965UZKAVZW (Verizon phone) which I discovered through the Samsung Members app. I'm mildly disappointed it's not an original unlocked phone, but that's only because I'm weird like that. The phone works with T-Mobile perfectly fine, and they didn't even give me any fuss at the store trying to claim it might lack features because I didn't buy it there (which would have been bogus because all snapdragon S9+ are physically identical). The screen had some very minor hairline scratches, but I can't see them at all now that I put a screen protector on. There was a little bit of paint wear around the camera, but for half the cost of a new one, I can live with that. I think my biggest gripe is how quiet the speaker is. If there's any amount of environmental noise around me (riding in a car, at an event, in wind, etc) I have to hold the phone close to my head to hear the speaker. At that point I might as well just take it off "speaker" and use the ear speaker.Overall, I'm very pleased so far.

column1: As advertised , but no ear piece volume.
column2: I was empressed that the phone was in very good condition. The only thing was it had no (very little) volume from the ear piece. I used a 10x magnifier to inspect the small screen and found that is was totally blocked , a goggle search about this issue (which is a common problem ) I cleaned it and the phone is now A 5 Star.

Had this phone about a week. So far so good. No issues other than when it arrived there was a sticky substance all over it. Had to remove it with Goo Be Gone and then wipe it down with alchohol pads to be on the safe side.

column1: This is not an unlocked phone
column2: This phone will not work with Visible a subsidiary of Verizon. Also while putting in my new SIM I noticed this phone came with a 32 meg card instead of the 128 I paid for. Very disappointed! I am having to buy a new phone.

i own this phone since January 1st, 2019, it worked fine (audio quality on a voice call is kinda bad) and yesterday, when i was doing my job, being on-call, it just died on me - THE BLACK SCREEN OF DEATH. I tried all the ways to restart it, nothing worked. I wonder if samsung can be sued if i lose my job because of this shitty phone

column1: Phone is great but buying on Amazon... not so much.
column2: I bought this phone brand new from amazon... it was very clearly used.The phone had been set to spanish (us) and already had a folder labeled "Applicacions de Microsoft" on it and the message app spelling dictionary only had the option for spanish (us).Cant trust anyone these days.On the bright side they included a phone case for free lol! Thanks who ever sent me this phone I appreciate that.It is a SM-G9650 (Snapdragon 845) cpu but because of that its region is set for china ... not the USA.So mine didn't come with the ability to do some stuff (wifi calling for example) that you would expect from a new phone.The phone itself is awesome.I have large hands and its just a little too big to use with one hand for me which is its only drawback.Most normal people would use it with 2 hands but I have to be different.The picture quality is great even when capturing action shots (tried to sneak a pic of my girlfriend but she moved and I made an ugly face for half a second... the picture is so clear its like we planned for her to do that face for the picture).It works with the Samsung Qi Certified Fast Charge Wireless Charging Convertible Stand/Pad and does fast charge on it.Coming from an iPhone 4 this thing is night and day difference but I bet you could say that about any new phone.When Iopen apps they open immediately.Browsing the web and watching youtube videos is smooth and uninterrupted... On my old iPhone the youtube app would lock up after an hour or so of use.Plus I can download apps again LOL!My old phone was so old it wouldnt get ios updates and its level of ios isnt supported by ANYTHING so I couldnt even get my email with it anymore!I did discover one thing that I don't like about it over the iPhone.... You cant turn off apps from being able to use mobile data in the foreground (you can turn off background usage).So if you are on data and you open up youtube or 9gag and start using it its using your data.On an iPhone if you go into your cellular data section of your settings and turn an app off it will not be allowed to ever use any mobile data unless you go back in and turn that back on.REALLY saves you from using data when you have a wifi connection available but not connected for whatever reason and you start browsing the web.

I switch from Apple (6s+) and I'm really happy I did. I love this phone so much. I thought I would have to relearn how to use an entirely new phone, however it was super easy to use. I does a lot of cool stuff and takes really nice pictures! The phone arrived sooner than expected shipping to an APO address.

column1: Great until the USB Port Stopped Working
column2: 4 major issues with this phone, and I think maybe other wireless charging phones have this problem too.There is no port cover to keep dirt from getting into the USB port. But if you wirelessly charge, it will build up dirt because you never plug it in to charge. Less than a year into ownership, the USB port stopped working entirely.Also there are basically NO good cases for this phone (because of the curved screen, nothing will stick to this phone for long). I tried 4 different cases and screen protectors before I finally settled on an all in one case screen protector combo, but the clear film used to protect the screen SCRATCHES easily.Finally, this phone's last major issue is the BIXBY button. PLEASE let us program this to open any app... we don't need your silly Bixby, Ok Google has us covered. One AI assistant is perfectly fine. Why would I need to take a picture of something I can just search for or talk into the phone and say?PS not a fan of the curved screen... def considering maybe Google Pixel next time...

This is my 2nd attempt to publish a review. The 1st one seems to have been ignored or removed.I received the phone defective.It would reboot all the time. I informed FAFA about this issue and they advised me to do a factory reset. This did not solve the issue. They then advised to send back the phone and they would fix it, but not refund. I requested a refund since I paid for a new phone, not a refurbished device. They advised that they could only do a partial refund. I did send back the phone (without original box) and was refunded 70% of the purchase price. Customer service was fast to respond, but losing 30% due to receiving a faulty phone is not what I would recommend to anyone.

Fast shipping. Super easy to set up on my existing Verizon account. The lilac purple is very pretty. This phone is awesome! I upgraded from the Galaxy S6 Edge + and it is a huge improvement. It is the first time I bought an unlocked phone and I think I will continue to do so as all the extra Verizon apps aren't present and in my way. Love it!

I needed a phone I could read after I dropped my phone on the concrete leaving lots of starburst cracks all over.It is taking a little while toget used to the features since I had an older one from my husband for some time.I am not a big techie but so far it is pretty good, even though I do not heed most of the apps.We couldn't afford to buy acompletely new one but this works great and the price much cheaper.

The phone doesn't charge by cable anymore and I've had it less than 3 months.Then when it is charged (currently using a charging pad) the battery runs down really fast. I had a S8 before and had better luck with quality. I also really dislike the position of the fingerprint reader.
One of the best purchases I have made on Prime. Cell arrived and it looked new. I have had zero problems with this phone since I purchased. I was very nervous at first but it workeds remarkable.

column1: One of the best phones still to this day
column2: Bought this for $350 on Amazon prime day and it was a solid choice. I switched from my iphone 6s to this and it was a huge improvement in almost everything the only thing that bothered me is the camera. Specifically how often pictures comes out blurry. This happens because it apparently takes 3 picture at once for the HDR and for lowlight pictures. Also I have an issue with calls on speaker mode where the person I call can't here 80% of what I say unless I have my headphones in. Other than that everything else was great especially for the amount I paid. The picture quality is top notch and I can easily see what I'm doing on my phone even with direct sunlight. Speakers are loud and clear, etc. Definitely worth its price

column1: DONT BUY THIS PRODUCT AT ALL!!!
column2: I WAS SKEPTICAL AND AFRAID TO BUY AFTER READING EVERY SINGLE REVIEW. I HOWEVER GAVE THEM THE BENEFIT OF THE DOUBT. IT WAS THE BIGGEST MISTAKE AND I REGRET EVERY DAMN SECOND. I HAD THIS PHONE FOR LITERALLY 8 HOURS! 8 DAMN HOURS. FOR THE FIRST FEW HOURS THE PHONE TURNED ON THE GRAPHICS ON THIS PHONE LOOKED AMAZING. I LEFT FOR A STORE RUN TO BUY A PHONE CASE AND SCREEN PROTECTOR. I WAS EXCITED. I PUT ON THE SCREEN PROTECTOR AND AS I WENT TO TURN IT ON....NOTHING... BLACK SCREEN. I DID EVERYTHING. I TRIED TO RESET IT, HARD RESET, PLUGGED IT IN TO ITS CHARGER NOTHING. BUNCH OF BULL. JUST DON'T BUY FROM THEM. DON'T EVEN BOTHER. I DON'T EVEN KNOW WHY THIS VENDOR IS EVEN STILL ALLOWED TO SELL PRODUCTS. THEY NEEDTO BE TAKEN DOWN. AMAZON NEEDS TO KNOW HOW THEY ARE EFFING THEIR CUSTOMERS OVER. JUST STAY AWAY.

By staying 1 generation behind the bleeding edge, I find the best products while they are still current.I gave up an S8 for this S9 and I love it.The earplug jack was a MUST for me. Thanks, Samsung, for listening to the complaints when Apple took theirs away!

This phone is very good.Battery life is pretty good.I wish the standby time would be better, but that is not Samsung's fault...android has poor standby battery life.Overall, I really enjoy using this phone.I highly recommend this to anyone who is looking for a feature-packed smartphone.

I received a defective Galaxy S9 Plus today.I will be returning. The screen had a couple of scratches & it the phone has been dropped which I was okay with, but when the speaker is blown out it's a big no no! And it keeps on going to the home screen when I'm using an app.

column1: Great phone that's still relevant and compatible with all US phone carriers
column2: My mom got this phone as a birthday present for her husband. This is definitely still a great phone to have. It has 4X4MIMO and the Qualcomm modem. It's definitely still a flagship and the top of the line in it's game.
This is the best phone I've ever owned. Its effective, quick, and cute. Battery life is a little less than a day's use, but I put this this to work. Well worth it.

I was considering the Iphone X - but after reading the pros and cons of each phone on *reputable* websites, I went with this *Awesome*Unlocked Samsung Galaxy S9+It is super fast and exceeds all of my expectations and no Verizon bloatware! The camera and iris scanner work incredibly well!
Fake S9. Biggest give away was the lack of manual from Samsung. Tried to activate phone and the serial number is already in use. They confirmed the other phone was real. This is a clone.

This phone is so awesome! Just popped in my Verizon SIM from my old Note 5 and then transferred my Note 5 data to it using the provided attachment and boom! A mostly set up phone. So happy with this purchase!

The phone itself is a wonderful phone, came in original package with all the right parts. My concern is that the phone doesnt seem to be unlocked for all carriers, when I opened the case it had a T-mobile manual for the phone, a T-Mobile sim and the box itself read T-Mobile. I am not able to truly check other carriers for I have T-Mobile as is.

Great shape. Easy to activate. Being used on straight talk via Verizon towers. I simply put my SIM card in it from my old phone. Came with everything I need,but need to buy new car charger since the connection is different than my old android. The charger it comes with is so fast. And phone books charge so much longer than my old phone
Nice phone but the speaker phone is defective according to every one who I speak to.And I didn't have insurance so I couldn't return it.

I bought this phone 3 months ago and can you believe, my phone has never dropped and it has blanked out on me three times! Three times! I'm sooo disappointed. The phone itself is a nice look but I can't speak to the glitch I'm having. Very disappointed. Love the color tho
I like the phone but this one died. The other 2 are working great.The exchange is slow especially when you need your phone. Still haven't got the replacement.

Ordered a 64GB S9 through Edge Cellular because of the 30 day money back guarantee, and I'm thrilled! I expected to see scratches or signs of usage, but it looks brand new. Battery life isn't quite as great as I'd hoped, but I can still get a full day out of it when I'm on it pretty regularly. I love it!

I have hadthe phone for less than 6 months. I tried to switch carriers today and when I ejected the sim card cradle it was broken and part is still in the phone rendering it useless as a phone. How do I find out if there is a warranty?

Apart from some connection issues, this phone is amazing. All the features work. However, it runs mostly on 3G because the process and downloads are not as fast as they should be. I believe all this could be fixed if I got back to provider on time. Unfortunately, when I wanted, it was out of warranty although the issues happened in the warranty period.

I would absolutely not recommend this phone. I have had nothing but problems with it. Many apps won't work. Many apps quit while running. Android auto disconnects constantly. I don't believe it's the S9+ directly but this particular unlocked version. I have had no issues with any other Samsung that I've purchased through my provider but this unlocked phone has given me nothing but problems.
Perfecto ..gracias..

column1: Great product, curved edges, not so cool
column2: Was and still is difficult to find a strong screen protector and correspondingly compatible phone protector case. The curved edges of the screen are the issue. Using a glass screen protector doesn't allow enough space to have a phone case that securely wraps around the phone enough to stay in place. The different cases have all pressed on the edges of the glass screen protector causing gaps between actual screen and protector making the phone useless. For now, I've opted for a stick-on screen protector, which scratches easily, to pair with the phone case.

Came as advertised. Phone is good so far. I've been an iPhone user for years then switched to this phone so it does take getting used to. I will say a few times/week my texts fail to go through so I have to restart the phone then resend the message, it's very annoying.

Very disappointed,there is no 64 GB card as indicated, no start up sheet as indicated and no tool as indicated to open card slot for placing SIM and memory cards.If these things cannot be provided, it's going back.

Needed a new unlocked phone to move from Verizon to consumer cellular. This works very well. Price was better than a S10 and I don't need the most current version. 'Unlocked' Verizon phones for not transfer well because of proprietary software embedded by VZ.

I am loving this phone so far. I am still navigating thru all its features and getting an understanding of what the phone really can do. I haven't ventured into its technical features a.sfar as PowerPoint or anything. I have to read the manual to discover all the aspects of the phone but so far I'm loving it!

column1: Unlocked phones don't connect to network well
column2: An unlocked phone does not connect to the ATT network like one bought from ATT.Husband bought same phone through ATT and can actually make and receive calls with 4 bars when I have no bars and can't call out. This is basically a wifi device for apps and internet.

Great phone, great features, scored points with my wife - she is a hardcore iPhone user but the S9 changed it all.Update -Purchased - July 28, 2018.Today - July 20, 2019 - coming up on 1 year in a few days. Wife still loves it. It is on the T-mobile network and has been working really well.

This phone was listed as unlocked and able to work on Verizon. After spending two hours in the Verizon store, they showed me on the phone where it was actually locked to Sprint. Total misrepresentation of what this product was supposed to be. Makes me question whether the phone was actually new or not. I wouldn't trust it, spend your money somewhere else.

column1: Great phone with a very small amount of annoyances.
column2: Love the phone. 256GB plus microSD slot. Fast. Nice screen. Headphone jack. Wireless charging.2 things really bother me-1- when unlocking the brightness starts BRIGHT and dims slowly. Very annoying at night.2- NO DUAL CAMERA MODE. So disappointed.
I just got my phone and opened the package just to realize the phone seems damaged and every single accessory is missing, the power up button is unresponsive and has fingerprints all over it

column1: S9+ has great pictures and battery life
