This phone is simple and fun to use. Gave it 4 stars because the screen has broke on 4 of these, just by taking off the back cover. When it breaks the LCD locks up and won't work at all. Pulled the glass off LCD and it looks perfect, just unresponsive. For the price it is ok.

column1: This is a very nice phone. I loved the interface and speed
column2: This is a very nice phone. I loved the interface and speed. I wanted to test other phones before the bigger iPhones came out a few months ago. I though this would be a great alternative. I finally went with the iPhone 6 Plus largely because of the greater app library. If the app library wasn't a serious buying criteria, I would have gotten a full version of this phone..

column1: Nokia Lumia 520 GoPhone - Fantastic  gps, camera, 720p video recorder,and mp3 player.
column2: Best Deal I have ever had on a gps, camera, 720p video recorder, mp3 player.$22 for this on sale.Fantastic! Haven't activated as phone because at&t is pricier than my current pay as you go plan.First time Windows 8 user.I seem to get along fine with this OS.

This is the best value for the money smart phone.Got it for my brother in Canada. He had it unlocked and was able to use it on Telus.All the awesome functionality of a smart phone minus the ridiculous price.Can't go wrong with this phone for travel or as a backup.

Damaged my primary phone, wanted a temporary backup phone for few day, so I bought this. When I saw the price my expectation were very low but it came to surprise it works pretty well its a good smart phone its slow but what you pay is what you get.Overall I am happy with this.

Nice basic smart phone, doesn't take the best pictures indoors but takes nice ones outdoors or in good indoor lighting. Windows is easy to navigate. Got this to use on my plan not as a go phone. Excellent price for that purpose. For the price you can't go wrong, works well

column1: Not an iPhone, but better than a flip phone!
column2: For my husband- he finally graduated to a "smartphone". Then new update lets him do the swiping to text which he loves. It is perfect for the techno-phobe. Super easy to set up thought the salesperson at ATT wasn't to happy that he wasn't going to wrangle us into a more expensive phone and plan.

It's a tiny Windows 8.1 tablet. Put in a 64 GB micro sd card and loaded tons of mp3's, movies and pictures. I use it in the car for navigation with HERE maps offline. This is really cool. At $29.00, are you kidding...you can't go wrong here. Oh yea and it's a great phone too.

This phone is a puzzle to use. Best source of instruction is user comments online, and trial and error. Accesses to functions are badly designed.Windows 8 and 8.1 live up to their poor reputation.Display good, call quality good, battery life good, but never again for this phone or Windows 8.

column1: I logged into the wifi at work and showed my boss how this $40 AT&T Go phone was more useful than the $1
column2: I bought the phone to check out the windows interface at work.For $40 it was worth it.My company has a thing for the IPhone and the IPad but all of our programs are flash based.I logged into the wifi at work and showed my boss how this $40 AT&T Go phone was more useful than the $1,200 worth of apple products he was carrying around.

I bought a couple of these to give to my parents. Upgraded them to WP 8.1, loaded all the apps the would normally use and added an 8gig MSD card loaded with pictures of their granddaughter. These phones are great for the price and just about on par with the iPhone 4.

column1: This phone has worked just fine. Still miss an actual flash and good camera ...
column2: After dropping my brand new Nokia Lumia 1020, I bought this as a temporary replacement.I am still using it, because the repair costs for my old phone were over 300.This phone has worked just fine.Still miss an actual flash and good camera though.

I liked the touch phone,this is my first touch phone.I like the features and everything.It is a very High- Tech phone,I can watch freemovies, listen to free radio stations and listen to free music.The only thing I don't like is the battery life.I have to charge the phone everyday.

column1: This will make a great backup phone for when my main one goes out
column2: This will make a great backup phone for when my main one goes out. Great price at the time ($20) not the best quality, or worst, but hey, who cares? It was only $20. Highly recommended.**The views in this review are mine alone, I was neither compelled or endorsed to write anything about this product**

I am using samsung galaxy note and started hating it because of it's slowness in opening application's. I bought this phone, It works great .. small phone .. nice features .. camera is OK .. screen is good .. WP8 is good and i like the responsiveness of the OS ... overall a good phone ...

column1: really good phone for the price
column2: good phone, plenty of memory. battery lasts pretty good but if you plan on playing a bunch of hi-res games you might consider something with a faster processor. a lot of features for the price and have had no issues with it, even dropped it a few times and it didnt crack.

I've been looking into a Windows phone for a few months since I got my laptop with Windows 8. The ability to connect everything via SkyDrive is very convenient.There are some apps that are popular in the iTunes and Android markets that are not yet available in the Windows App store, but they are being developed quickly and aren't that big of a loss (to me).Excellent phone!

WOW! you got it to me so fast. thank you. all i had to do was upgrade the phone, call att and it is on and i am using it as my phone with our friends and family contract. you should let people know this is not just a go phone. you can have a smart phone on your contract for $50.

I bought this December 2, 2013. Worked OK for nearly 2 years but died a slow death over the past several weeks.Not very intuitive to use.Replaced with the Microsoft Lumina 640.Why pay ten times more for an iPhone or Samsung in either case?

I've had the phone a couple of weeks.For $60 bucks - wow!Good.Windows is better than expected.Feels nice. Good screenCamera is fun.BadDoesn't have reception when other phones do.This may be because it does not have LTE.No flash.

Good phone, runs newest updates after a couple hours of updating. Ordered a second one, this is a great price for a good windows phone, it can use a sim from regular Att service,, can NOT be unlocked.If you want a quality , mid range phone , this would be a good choice.

I've had the chance to use this phone and compare it to my Nokia 920. Both are fast, easy to use. The Lumia 520 is nice because it's so small! The only downside to this phone is the lack of a front-facing camera and the build quality feels just a little less than solid than the 920. I would absolutely recommend it for someone looking for a good, reliable phone.

I've been having this phone for almost a year now. I give it five stars. I have no complaints whatsoever. I put an SD Card in it to have more memory, it is great. The phone is fast and has never given me any problems. At this price, this is the best phone.

Love this phone...very clear/crisp screen...good response to touch...filled with performance features...and the price is so reasonable.I'm still "learning" all that this phone can do - but so far I am extremely satisfied with Nokia and the Windows 8.1 system.

column1: Its a fully capable smart phone for under $60
column2: The price of this phone still baffles me. Its a fully capable smart phone for under $60. That's amazing. Works great, windows is still growing as a mobile os, so expect some shortcoming as far as apps. It can be a bit slow at time, but think about how much you're paying for it.

I had this phone for a little over a year. It survived being a dogs chew toy (dogs teeth never scratched the screen but I did have to replace the plastic case), multiple drops on tile and concrete, and a plunge in the toilet. I ultimately replaced it with a newer windows Lumia phone only because well...it went in the toilet and that's kind of gross. I have to hold this thing to my face, you know. Highly recommended.

column1: Best phone you will get for 40 bucks
column2: Best phone you will get for 40 bucks. It is still windows (lousy). It's missing some features you have taken for granted, front camera, pull down bar to access stuff and a bunch of others. Overall a solid back up phone which will make you really appreciate your android.
Phone did not come with SIM card.

This is the first Windows OS cell phone I have owned. I use it only as music player during my workouts. After trying the SIM card I removed it since it wasn't necessary for my purpose. It has been plagued with several minor annoyances the most recent being a need to remove the battery to reboot the phone. The touch screens are much to sensitive.

column1: Makes a great MP3 player or secondary phone.
column2: A perfectly workable low-end smartphone for $30. I put a 64GB Micro-SDHC card in it, loaded it up with music, and it's by far the best and cheapest MP3 player I've ever owned (and I haven't even put a SIM in it).

This is a heckuva of a phone for $40.We are impressed by the phone's operating system and functionality.The phone comes loaded with Windows 8.0 and needs an update immediately to 8.1.You'll be glad you did....since Cortana is a super intelligent version of Siri.

column1: A FREE back up phone! Almost as good as iPhone6
column2: Unbelievable! I dropped my iPhone6 a week after I got it. The glass cracked and I had to pay $200 to replace it. So I bought this as a back up. It works beautifully and almost as good as my iPhone6. AT&T costs $25 a month and the phone was FREE practically!

Boyfriend loves this fun, it was a gift. It syncs up with his Windows 8 laptop perfectly. Very user friendly, lots of apps, and the Att gophone plan for $40 a month is good choice for someone who browses the internet, and plays games, and uses email and texts, sms/.mms. There alot of cool things about phone and it was only $80 dollars!!!

bought it for my boyfriend who was still using old flip phone with no other benefits. lol. got this beautiful phone which is such an upgrade to what he was using. beautiful and ready to use with his same sim card. did have to go to att store to get smaller sim card though. no biggie

column1: A fun phone, i like the design and the nokia ...
column2: A fun phone, i like the design and the nokia services (maps, music) are awesome. On the downside, the design of the inside of this phone is really flawed! Its freaking impossible to get your SIM card in the slotsand I damaged both slots trying to do so. So now, the phone simply is used over wifi. Great price, poor design

column1: TRICK TO GET AROUND STOLEN PHONES
column2: THIS PHONE IS EXCELLENT.MY DAUGHTER'S NEW IPHONE WAS STOLEN.NEVER BUY WARRANTIES.THOSE ARE RIP OFFS.I BOUGHT THIS PHONE FOR $ 50 INSTEAD OF USED IPHONE FOR HUNDREDS OR ANY OTHER PHONE LIKE THAT.WORKS GREAT.WE ARE USING THE SAME CONTRACT WITH NO ADDITIONAL PENALTY WITH ATT.

column1: Great Phone, buy more Windows Phones!
column2: Buy more Windows Phones.This may be the low-end Windows Phone, but for the average user this will provide more functionality than you need.Additionally all the features of the Windows ecosystem with an ever developing app store makes this buy a lead-pipe cinch

I love this inexpensive, yet very very nice phone. Bought it as a replacement for my ailing android and it really does the job very well. GPS, music player, phone, sms, decent camera, games......you name it....... The only problem is with the Microsoft App store, the store still has lot of catching up to do in comparison to Playstore or iTunes store.....The phone is great in itself.

I bought this as a test (I have an iPhone now) to see how I liked Windows Phone.It's a nice operating system, but I don't think I'll change.This was a special around the holidays and I ended up selling it to a friend with a broken screen and he says it works great.

column1: great price and a great started phone
column2: this phone lasted for four years until we upgraded. It still works it just doesn't need to be used currently but will be passed on to my youngest child here soon. great price and a great started phone

column1: It's easy to update and personalize
column2: I had bought three of these phone for my family and I have say that this is way than what I expected for a very cheap prize. It's easy to update and personalize. There is a huge library of both paid and free games in the windows store as well as many essential apps for every day use weather you're student, a professional, or a common user. This phone feels as if you're with a mobile desktop and is very impressive. Also, for those that are looking a a cheap plan, AT&T has a $100 year plan which comes with 1000 minutes.

My wife has been after me for years to get one. I wanted something cheap, technologically up-to-date and contract free. This seems to fill the bill, and I'm sure I'll learn to use it eventually. It looks just like the high priced toys so everyone around me is happy now.

First smart phone that I have ever owned and it has surpassed all of my expectations. For everything it is able to do at a low reasonable price you just cannot beat it. True it is not one of the fastest but if you are looking for a good smart phone that won't break the bank and won't disappoint then you cannot beat the Nokia Lumia 520.

Bought my Lumia 520 Windows phone from Tiger Direct for $85. Loved it! The sound is clear; touch screen is responsive; Windows 8 is stable; apps are smooth; battery life is OK. I didn't experience random crash as some reviewers experienced.But compared to iPhone and Samsung Galaxy phones, this phone sure has some problems.1. The icon buttons sometimes are confusing.2. Starting up is slow.3. The cover is easy to fall off.But given the price, I think I got more than I paid for.

I did get this phone on sale and if it were not on sale at the time it would have still been a good deal. I have a iphone 4 and that I had to pay over $100.00 a month to use. I can do everything that I did with my iphoneon this Nokia for $60.00. This includes Data. The Phone is well made and easy to operate...Hope this helped

I had to unlock it and it cost me the same as buying a new one. The phone is fine though. Hard, great glass (no scratch with clumsy user) and pretty fine for a gamma media phone. What makes me hate it is that it comes with fabric problems (it turns off every now and then) and it's not the battery. I bought three and just two had that problem.

Bought the phone for my mom some of the apps are formatted differently for the windows phone and she previously had a android phone; she mainly uses it being a single woman who likes to have a phone if she breaks down on the side of the road or needs to call AAA

The thing just died last night. No rough handling, drops, bumps, etc. Screen is just frozen on and won't take but a small charge.LATER in the day......my phone was so run down that the screen froze, and wouldn't respond. A friendly gentleman at the local AT&T just took the back off, popped out the battery, and then put it back in maybe 30 seconds later. It just needed to be re-set. My bad, love the phone, never had one before and now I'm lost without it. My wife has an Iphone5 and she's getting one like this when her contract expires. Please ignore prior tantrum.

column1: I bought it for $50 in July 2014 and I am quite happy with it
column2: I have the Tmobile 521.I bought it for $50 in July 2014 and I am quite happy with it.I hope everyone realizes this is a $20 GPS device that can be used without any SIM or phone signal, if you wish to use it that way.It is a pretty good phone too.The Cons are the weaker app store, no camera on the front, no flash on the rear camera, but I wouldn't honestly expect all that at $50 and under.This is an excellent back up phone, which I have used as such.
Excellent phone for the price and easy to use. I would say it more of your middle of the road product but then again I didn't have to spend hundreds of dollarsfor it so that is certainly a plus.

column1: Underwelmed but cheap decent temp phone.
column2: Used as a temporary phone for my girlfriend.Honestly even given what it is we were underwelmed.Camera stunk really bad and even for a no contract phone functioned and was built flimsy.There are better phones for close or as much as this that are no contract.
It replaced a flip phone I have carried for 15 years.I am still learning how to use it.The fact that it is windows makes it easier nd the price was great.

Like the phone; quality and price are good.I came from using iPhone 3GS and can't afford or justify the price of the new iPhone.Just having a hard time adapting to Windows OS and lack of applications available with Apple, but for the price I can get over it.

column1: This phone is awesome for the level it is
column2: This phone is awesome for the level it is!!! It is better Than I thought!!! Sure, it's not a 900 series or higher, but for the $, can't beat it!! Social media and music is easier to Use than iPhone, and I like the bing maps app over all other phones! Very simple to use!!!!

column1: My first Smartphone and I love it
column2: This is one great phone.Perfect for me.If you're familiar with Microsoft Windows products and features, this is an easy phone to use.I had no problems figuring out the settings and getting it up and running right away.It's an attractive phone, as well.

Bought this for my adult daughter; we are out of our at&t contract, & I have no desire to sign another contract.I bought this, and she couldn't be happier with it.She loves it!I have been so impressed with it that I will be purchasing another one, for myself this time, in the very near future!

Didn't expect so much from a low end phone. Occasional jitters are still seen when too many apps are at work. Win 8.1 and Cortana, seriously rock.Sadly a phone without camera flash. However the preinstalled apps like Wi-Fi Sense are awesome.A refreshing update to WP.

If I rate this, am I rating the hardware or the experience on the phone? :)I wanted to try out the experience on a Windows Phone and this was really really cheap, so I thought why not. The phone's screen has a higher resolution than I expected, which can be nice, but this is a really small phone. So some games, even websites, end up really really small.(Example, there's an Age of Empires game in the store, and the little military men are actually quite hard to see; but they're there. Gotta hold it right up to your head to get a lot of the small details like that)Speaker's decent for such a cheap phone, and it's really light.

column1: I like the fact that it's exactly what I wanted
column2: I like the fact that it's exactly what I wanted. The features are good and it is performing nicely. What I did not like is that the phone is locked. I like buying unlocked phones so that I can decide the service provider I want at any given time. Thanks

column1: ... the phone itself not the seller the seller was awesome I give them five stars the phone itself was ...
column2: This review is of the phone itself not the seller the seller was awesome I give them five stars the phone itself was not to my liking its app store is lacking to say the least and most of my problem with the phone stems from that I can not do most of the stuff I enjoy doing on this phone

column1: its not that great as many say......
column2: i was glad to get the phone. it was good for the first 2 months or so. then it just randomly started turning off or restarting. and you can't download many apps. and your screen can freeze up too. i don't really recommend it but it u want a crappy phone, then its for you.

I would have never dreamed this phone would have had so many great features at the price it sells for. Not long after I had the phone it prompted me to update to Windows 8.1. This is my first smartphone and I am pleasantly surprised at all I can do with this phone.

Bought this phone at $20 hey what a DealI always like to have spare Att phones in case of an emergency weather I lose my current phone or my battery dies all I have to do is switch the SIM cards.For what I paid for it it was a great deal.

I really like this phone. My other one had messed up and I needed a new one as soon as possible. Of course with phone these days I couldn't afford to buy one at an early upgrade. I came across this on amazon and figured I would give it a try. It works pretty well for a smart phone. I plan on using this until my next upgrade.

I have never had any problems with Nokia phones in the past, so I wanted to try this one, and I am very pleased with it. I have no problems so far and have been using the phone for a little more than a month.Shipment was fast and give the seller an A++++++++++++.

Bought this to use on a regular at&t plan. Great starter phone upgrade from a basic phone. Camera is much better than expected. Has a feature that let's my mother, with shaking hands, get a least one good shot. Cheap, effective windows phone.

I'm convinced the reviews on this phone have been posted by the seller. I know it's a cheap throwaway phone, but it's been horrible from day 1. It doesn't ring most of the time, the alarm rarely works, and connecting to bluetooth is spotty at best. I would love a refund!

column1: Ok, but it's windows and camera is just ok
column2: Day 1 of use...I have owned both (low end) Android and (5s) iPhone as well as have a kindle fire.Windows phone is going to take some getting used to. Even typing now, there doesn't seem to be robust auto correct and the word suggest is too slow to be very useful. As to phone itself...incredible value and the app transitions are smooth. No crashes yet. Little slow, but can't complain considering how little it cost. Camera doesn't seem great but haven't played with it a lot. I am a little disturbed by how many apps require location services be enabled. Can't fathom why people would give this 5 stars, or 1 for that matter.Update after a few days of use: Turns out the OS had some updating to do, and there is now indeed some swipe down functionality.Battery life is average; I can get through a day no problem with light-moderate usage.Web browsing is my biggest complaint...some sites take quite a while to load, and I haven't been able to view some content.I would still say the phone is noticeably slow with app transitions, and I have experienced some app crashes, but it's not a deal breaker at all; it's a tradeoff one can accept given the value.Another thing to note, I don't have data with my plan ($10 at pure talk USA), so I only use the "smart" part on wi-fi.Overall, some minor annoyances, but given that I bought a capable smartphone for $20, that's nothing to complain about.3 stars for the phone itself; 4 stars for sure if you consider the value.

Wow! What a great deal I got on this phone. It was only $19.00 when I bought it and I saved about $80.00.It is a beautiful phone and an updated one, too.It reminds me of my Dell computer with the tiles and everything else.Buy it and you will not be sorry .

I have totally enjoyed this Nokia Lumia smartphone!The camera is really great and it even takes very good pics in low light.Somehow it adjusts the light and the pics come out brighter.I have one and my two daughters bought one.....we love, love, love them all!

The best reasonably priced phone made for prepaid phones.I owned one a couple of years ago and it takes great pictures and had absolutely zero problems with it.I ordered this for my son for Christmas and he loves it, too!

Just picked up this phone after I lost my iPhone.The only downside I can find is it does not have GPS or face camera - so you cannot Skype.I really like the flexibility of being able to add my own storage and upload MP3s without having to deal with iTunes.It also hives more flexibility with ringtones.One other drawback is the narrow width which makes a small keyboard.If you are tired of being a slave to apple and long phone contracts and payments because ATT lured you into financing or signing a contract - this phone is a terrific alternative

I wasn't sure about trying another windows phone but for the price of $19.99 i thought why not. It works great. i can use it with my xbox 360 which is nice. The speakers sound really good too. I would buy another nokia limina b4 i buy another samsung windows phone. and I got my phone on Christmas Eve.

I got this for my daughter who is 26.She likes it a lot.She's hard on phones and so far so good.Had it since August 2014.I played around with it a little and I can't believe how fast it responds to your touch.It's a lot faster than my iPhone 5.

I bought this phone because it said "unlocked" and can be used anywhere in the world. Unfortunately, the phone is not unlocked and I could not use it internationally with a different SIM card like I wanted to.

I love this photo. There are so many features that just didn't come with the iPhone. I went from iPhone 3 , I hated it, to this phone which is so much better. Great price too. Very happy with this purchase and I highly recommend it if you want a easy but good phone.

column1: Great for a kid's mini-tablet with no service...
column2: I got this as an mp3 player/mini-tablet for my 8 year old.He doesn't have a phone, yet, and I am not connecting service to this one.He can use Skype, etc. to call or text me via wireless if needed. For $19.99 it was a wonderful deal.He loves it!

The phone is compact and fits well in the palm of my hand. Contains great features and an intuitive operating system. Priced perfectly. There' something for everyone with the prepaid plan options. I highly recommend this phone. I was using an iPhone 4.

This is a great phone at a great price. My only concern after using the phone for about 6 months is that I found the windows store to be a bit lacking in comparison to android and apple. Before getting this phone make sure all of your essential apps are on the store.

perfect for my daughter. she loves the phone. Nothing compared to my Lumia 920 but for $50 it was a steal.would buy again. Installed 8.1 preview with Cortana (using my account first and then reset with my daughter's account). My son is already asking.

at first i waz ah bit worried dat i bought something daz waz goin 2 b ah waste of money but i jus waited and when it came i waz proven wrong~!!!!!!!!! this phone is amazingly quick and looks beautiful>>>>>>>> i love my windows pone

I love this phone.It is all that I need in a phone.It is cheap but it provides very good service.I have had it for three weeks now.I am still learning all about it.It connects with a computer Very easily.I love that I can use Wi-Fi instead of costly cell data.It has a reasonably good display.The phone call quality it good.I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a phone.

column1: Windows OS makes for affordable SmartPhone!
column2: This phone is excellent. I'm not into the hottest technology because its over excessive in price & functionality. This item is simple & is easy to work with. The thin, sleek design gives it a nice light weight feel without feeling paper weight cheap.
Slower than ants, constantly crashes (China) go figure !!!!

If you want a low end (mostly for phone calls) this is a very good phone. Limited selection of apps but it was everything I needed. If you want a phone for texting and browsing you may want to get a phone with a larger screen.

We recently entered the "data" age with the cell phones.We are a family of four.We all have them and do not have any complaints.I am very pleased with the way my windows phone works with my home and work computer.I literally have everything at my fingertips now.And for $60, you really cannot go wrong.We have an ATT plan and the store transfered and moved us over to the new phones with no activation fees.So these are not only Go Phones.The only drawback might be is that the windows apps are just now catching up with the android and Itunes.But not a big deal with us.I would highly recommend this phone, especially for the cost of the phone.I can only imagine what the most current Lumia phones will do for you.:)

The only reason I bought this phone is I like Nokia products, and I am happy that it meets my expectations. The only drawback I found in this phone is the build quality, its screen as well as its back body. I think because of the sharp edges the screen is prone to breaking easily. Infact, the first Lumia 520 fell off my hand (from almost 2 feet height) and broke, there were large cracks on the screen, luckily Amazon replaced it with a new piece.It takes good pictures, the screen quality is good,touch is super sensitive, battery life is decent, Windows has sufficient apps. It feels good in hand. Overall its a nice product, worth buying for the price.

Affordable, simple, stylish. What more can you ask for in a phone? Loved it!Especially for the low price, this phone is worth the buy for your grandparents, parents, and anyone in your life who just want a simple smart phone.

Very fluid movement, no lag. I'm really used to apple products so I was a little skeptical, but this is a very simple and easy to use phone for a great price. And 40$ a month for unlimited texting and 500 minutes? Can't go wrong with that. Very surprised!

I had to use AT&T service in order for them to take the lock off.So I bought it from WalMart and used WalMart phone service.I like the phone but hate it doesn't offer some of the services Android does.I will be switching back to Android soon.

the windows phone o/s is the best ... period !got this for $49 + my friends put me on their at&t plan ( i am NOT a fan of at&t, but it is working out quite well being on their plan + i am grateful ) ... nokia rocks ! ... many blessings + thx !!!

I've used enough of my friends' smartphones to know what features and characteristics that I like and do not like.My biggest hesitation for buying a smartphone without a contract is the price...it just seems like a waste of money unless you have the extra $400-500 for an iphone or droid.This phone is awesome and FAST.I love everything about it: the volume levels, the ease of the touchscreen and the size of the screen.It's amazing that I only spent $60 for this phone, it looks way more expensive than that.One happy customer here :)

column1: Great phone for an awesome price
column2: This is a great phone for a budget price. Of course it's missing a few bells and whistles (forward-facing camera, LED flash)--but you have to give up something if you want such a low-cost phone. The Windows operating system works well; its design is uncluttered and pleasing. Call quality is great. The touch screen is very responsive. HERE maps are awesome--if you download the maps you can use them offline, so you can navigate as much as you need without drawing on a data plan! Great if you want to use a pay-as-you-go plan to save money.

Love my Windows phone! Easy to learn and use... :-) I had someone on stand by for assistance but didn't need the help. I figured it out and love the options. Yeah, I recommend it! I had a straight talk phone which is at &t compatible so it was an easy transfer.

column1: Great first phone, or use it as an ipod !!!
column2: I have purchased two of these for my teenagers.Great phone for the price.Note that it is not as nice as my Lumia 920, but perfect for a first phone.Note that this also works great as a wi-fi only ipod or game device.The second one I purchased arrived with a non-functioning volume up button.Amazon replaced the phone at no charge.This phone can also be used as a replacement for an AT&T contract phone, but you will have to contact AT&T and have them send you a new SIM card.

I love this phone. Works great and fun to customize.I am not big on games and other apps but **Do NOT get this phone if you like Apps**Windows does not have as many apps/games to choose from.This phone is durable and works very good

column1: This is a great value for a smartphone
column2: This is a great value for a smartphone, but it did have a few nagging issues that irritated me.it tended to lock up on occasion and the screen is a little small.Spend the money on the Nokia 635 as it is much better for the price.

column1: Price is good, a bit complicated to use
column2: I bought my grandparents these phones because they wanted smart phones. The price was right but they are not user friendly. I set the phones up for them and gave them lessons that is when I discovered they are a bit complicated to operate.

column1: But while the phone was working I was satisfied with the speed everything loaded
column2: Just a little bummed because I charged the phone, got everything programmed then all of a sudden it started shutting off by itself. So, I got a defective battery but hopefully it will all work out. But while the phone was working I was satisfied with the speed everything loaded, and how easy it was to navigate the windows.

I bought this product to use as a secondary phone in case my iPhone stopped working, like I thought it might. Overall, it has good battery life, usually around 18 hours, and it has worked well with be included AT&T goPhone plan. I couldn't get it to work with a bring your own phone Tracfone SIM card, but other than that, no issues. I love the expandable storage with the microSD.

column1: Works well for what I need and if I break it not a big loss
column2: got 2 of these to use with Straight Talk during the $20 sale.Great value runs great only downside is no flash but I knew that going in.Windows phones don't have as many apps but I am very happy using it as it does everything I need.

column1: Lumia lover but married to android after divorcing IOS
column2: As title says, initially I owned iphone for over 5 years. I owned all iphones except the first one. Last year, just for change, I sold iphone 5 and bought used lumia 900 cyan. It was a great change after owning iphone for years. I still remember the clear black display and glossy curved screen. Within 2 months I bought lumia 920 off eBay before release. I used it for 4 months and was very happy with everything except the weight. I usually keep my phone in upper shirt pocket ,so I always felt lumia 920s weight. This year I sold Lumia 920 and bought HTC One. Great Phone, great resolution, stable OS, great speaker etc.Recently in Amazon Deals I found lumia 520 for 79 dollars without contract. Amazon has made one click too easy. So without thinking I just clicked.I got the phone within one day.My notes on this phone:Stable OS. I love windows 8. Clean OS and a good change from ios and android. Once it gets good apps then I think It will be on top soon.Great looks and availability of swappable multi color back covers.Awesome battery life. It reminds me olden days. I always used the battery saver mode. I charged this phone 3 days ago and it has some 35% left. I have to admit I didn't use it more than an hour for past 3 days. But doing the same with my HTC One, the battery will be dead in just 1 day. May be non availability of LTE runs it longer.Screen is good but not great. Though the resolution is almost same as lumia 900 ,I feel lumia 900 screen is much better than this one.The PPI on this phone is more then lumia 900 but lumia 900 screen looked sharp.I never found pixels in lumia 900. In this phone certain colors clearly shows pixels. The color of screen does makes difference. Green colors show pixels more then blue.If you planning to cut SIM and use it then be careful. I think the thickness of regular SIMgives very tight fit on this phone. Though micro Sims slips very easily.Camera is not great. It's an average camera for basic photography.Price is unbeatable. Spend 3 dollars and its unlocked.I didnt feel there is any signal problem on this phone. You can hold any ways unlike iphone.Speaker is average. Sound is just enough.Voice is clear over conversation.Overall i recommend this phone for the low price.Can be a great secondary phone.

column1: Pretty good. Window's phone, no Android
column2: Not a bad phone. The camera doesn't seem to take the best pics. Plus, it's not Android, so there seems to be plenty of app's you can't get. I'm also not a big fan of Windows. However, I got mine for $20. So all in all worth it.

column1: It's always nice to have a
column2: It's a phone that works, only $20 so there's no reason to complain. I just saved it for when I broke my phone and it totally happened so for that purpose I'll give it 4*'s. It's always nice to have a backup
Cool phone for kids

In these days when a basic phone can cost upwards of $200, I find the Nokia Lumia 520 an exceptional value! I've had the phone for only three weeks but it has clearly demonstrated its value-for-money.The phone is a communication, productivity and entertainment tool. It meets my expectations.The phone audio is feature filled. It executes the basic function of making and receiving phone calls efficiently and reliably. The audio is also crystal clear.The OneNote feature on the phone allows me to capture my thoughts which I often do.The audio and video recording functions of the phone make it possible to capture meeting notes or other events of interest.I'm over the top pleased with the ability to download documents, annotate PDFs and produce documents on the phone.I like the one-touch title feature that allows one touch access to often-used features.The phone has navigation functions that do not require to be online.The phone comes with a cloud feature which while useful I don't use because of privacy concerns.The expandable memory capacity allows storing of many resources on the phone.With its light weight, the phone is a great option for leaving my heavy laptop at home when I travel.I highly recommend the phone to anyone looking for an inexpensive, reliable phone.I rated the product four stars because I've only had it for three weeks but it could easily be rated five stars. I look forward to many good future confirming experiences with the Nokia Lumia 520.

best kept secret, I love showing dumb I phone users how awesome my phone is for under fifty bucks I will always want a windows phone over any other phone, especially android, there is no comparing the two, this one is really worth it

column1: Best phone for the price by far!
column2: Holy smokes does this phone pack a punch for the price.It is far from the latest or greatest but for the price it is a GREAT phone.Heck i have one for just an internet device for my daughter and nephews when they get overly bored.

This is the best twenty dollars well spent. It does about everything that a smartphone suppose to do. It lacking a flash, mega pixel ,front face camera and screen size.But all this can be over looked.Good for back up or permenant use. With windows 8.1 update it caught up with other phone os. It now has a notification screen, coretra similar to Siri and nokia music is a plus.

column1: product is great if you get a good one
column2: so I was really happy to get this phone and it came really fast but I had problems right out the box. The phone battery wasn't holding life, and the SIMS reader was reading so I had to return it and I went to the store to get it but the process of returning the product wasn't that bad. All I'm trying to say is the phone is great jus hope you get a good one sent but your best bet is buying off the store in case you have problems you have some one to talk to. im not blaming any one here all im doing is giving a heads up that can come with the phone.

column1: Overall great phone, FOR THE MONEY!
column2: This phone won't set any speed records, but it runs the latest versioin of windows phone and performs decently. When you consider what you are paying for a no contract phone, this is an awesome deal. The Windows OS is so much easier to navigate than either IOS or Android.

Came on time and was in perfect condition, new in box. The packaging was a bitch to open though lol. Overall the phone works very well. Put my at&t sim card in and worked right away! (I am on a two year contract and it still worked) Can only get third party versions of certain apps like snapchat and instagram is the only bad thing.

column1: Good build-quality phone hamstrung by terrible OS
column2: Good build quality for what is a pretty cheap phone. I used it as a backup phone. The only negative is the Windows operating system, which despite a few good things (Cortana, for example), pretty much sucks. If this were running Android, it'd cost $300.

So far...I love this phone.It is somewhat taxing to get all your Nokia...Microsoft...Google...Outlook accounts in sync and registered...etc.However...once you get it all set up...this phone is amazing.I can go on and on.
Was my phone for a year before I accidentally broke it, my fault.I like the windows interface, the build in GPS, and offline map modes. Works really well for car GPS that doesn't need a data plan.

I bought this as a Christmas gift for a friend when amazon had a daily deal going on it. She absolutely loves it and has had no problems thus far. She had a really crappy go phone with half the numbers chewed off originally though so anything was better than what she had. But if you're looking for something to get you by between contracts, or want a decent phone that's not too pricey yet still functional, I think you'd be happy with this phone.

column1: Like the phone if it didn't break on me so easily.
column2: I want to give this more stars because I liked the phone a lot but I have bought two and had both screens crack in under a few months from minimal pressure. The screen is not touch receptive once it cracks, even a tiny one, the phone no longer works.

column1: Windows based phone and my high schooler is totally happy with it
column2: This was purchased as a replacement for the same phone, not because the phone was damaged but because I broke off a headphone jack in the phone - cheaper to just replace it, especially at this cost! It is reliable, Windows based phone and my high schooler is totally happy with it.

Is a good phone and the price was great ❤️ You can use Wi-Fi and be in Facebook Instagram and all thise media sites so is really really good phoneI really like it I use it for my trip to Mexico as a go phone from AT&T and I got a very good signal and that was really good phone over there so I really really like it. Love the price $29.99

No words. 49$ without contact full retail price. Great phone.Speed is good. Battery last for one full day with two email account , facebook sync.wordflow, whatsApp, HERE entire USA map offline, camera app still image are the great plus.No front camera. After a month use, ATT okey to provide unlock code.Highly recommended.

The phone was worth the money. Their are hardly any apps but, I have no extra fees on my phone plan since I'm not leasing a phone & it's not worth the money to add insurance on the phone because it's so cheap after paying the deductible (and getting a refurbished phone) its cheaper to buy another new phone.

Very easy to use phone, even if you are not familiar with Windows 8. Although this is sold as a go phone, I replaced my AT&T I-phone with this, with no problems. One of the best features is the customizable screen I see when I first turn it on!

column1: a pretty good iPod substitute as it takes a micro SD ...
column2: The price was spectacular! Keyboard was too small for me. I use a Moto X as my primary phone. For the price, a pretty good iPod substitute as it takes a micro SD card. And it doesn't hurt to have a spare phone around just in case.

Not a bad starter phone, I purchased mainly for cortona it is very user friendly, unlike siri or google this tells jokes and has mild conversations with the way it should be a great helper, the phone is very responsive has its moments of lacking but all and all not bad

column1: Very nice phone for the price, if you're OK with Windows OS.
column2: Nice phone for the price, but Windows OS takes a little getting used to.Display glass shows fingerprints.Battery needs charging almost daily (but I'm used to a Razr Maxx, with very long battery life, and much more expensive).

I purchased this item for it's non-cell phone capabilities. It makes a GREAT mini tablet. Using windows 8.1 is a wonderful system. It is fast enough for all the apps I've used. I will take this on vacation next time we leave the country because if I lose it, I won't feel bad losing it due to its low price.

This is the second one of these I've had I sent the first one back it stopped working after only a few days this second one give issues also it just not very good quality made phone I do like the features though and it works on straighttalk

column1: Great phone for what we needed
column2: Bought the phone for a vacation to St. John USVI.Phone has worked great for what we wanted it for.First time using a Windows based phone.Not too hard to get used to.Only real complaint would be the lack of a flash, but knew that when we got it.

column1: ... and not being locked in to a contract is nice. I like the layout and how you can ...
column2: So many features for the low price and not being locked in to a contract is nice. I like the layout and how you can personalize it and link it with so many accounts. I do have to charge mine a lot more than I anticipated but am told this is not unusual for phones. This is my first smartphone and I wanted something inexpensive.
Horrible little phone, and I do mean LITTLE, as in tiny keyboard and screen.My fault for not reading measurements.Alsdo, after HOURS spend, could not get Google contacts to load.

This phone has lasted me about 6 months before it started to bug out. It now constantly shuts off and restarts on its own(thus reseting the date and throwing off the message threads), and has stopped allowing me the ability to view text messages from several people. It has worked fairly well up until a month ago but now it's just getting old.I wish i could recommend this phone but your better off looking else-were.

I was excited to try a windows phone since I am already familiar with android and apple products. It was definitely different, took some getting used to. The operating system itself isn't terrible, but I'm not a fan. There aren't as many apps like the other operating systems, n some of the "apps" are just a link to the webpage so I uninstalled and just pinned the link so it was less space used on the phone. My complaints about the phone first off the side unlock button stopped working like maybe a month after I got it (if that). So since I have to either hold down the camera button n back out of it or plug in the phone just to wake it up, very annoying. Another thing is that the whole auto focus on the camera sucks I've had a handful of people try and take a photo and they can't because it comes out blurry.Also my phone did not come with a micro sd card, probably one of my first phones that didn't include at least a 1g. I wanted to give it one star but I have to give it 2 because it's pretty good at not dropping calls. Gets service everywhere regular AT&T costumes get. Also as a testament to how bad this phone is my husband lost his phone and I suggested buying one of these as a temp replacement and he looked at me like I had 3 heads n said "that hunk of junk, no thank you!"Oh and I can't believe I almost forgot, lately my phone as been shutting off randomly, sometimes it turns right back on and sometimes I have to plug it in to turn it on (because the lock button doubles as the power button). Also for a couple months the phone will randomly go black and I have to wait until it locks itself so I can then unlock it so the screen turns back on.Also I purchased this phone in mid October 2013 and it's given me that many problems in less than 4 months!
Good chip smart telephone . I used as my travel telephone with local chips so i need very simple functions for it and works smothless.(I asked AT&T to unblocked and they were very kind and do it.)

great phone! unless you are a technology crasy person that has to have thlatest of everything, this phone is great. it does all the fancy stuff the other phones do .i am really impressed also makes a great first phone for teens.

Purchased this for my son to have/use while he is riding back and forth to school.This is a really nice smartphone for the price. Obviously you can get a better SmartPhone, but comparable models are more than $200. It's very cool that you don't see slow downs or unresponsiveness that you see in low end Android models (this is probably because of the Windows Phone OS).

column1: works well with Straight Talk - if you're going the ...
column2: works well with Straight Talk - if you're going the straight talk route, need to be prepared to research on-line for a while to find the proper apn settings to get the text and internet to work.That was a bit frustrating.

For $39.99 this is the best smartphone you can get.Join the developer preview and you can update this to windows phone 8.1 with the cyan firmware.It runs things very well.After using this phone for 3 months I bought windows phones for my entire family.I used a straight talk AT&T Sim in this and it worked fine

This phone was arrived in my mailbox before the anticipated delivery date, and it works as I expected. I like that I can access wifi hotspots. The phone is smooth, and it operates fluidly. It is a great purchase for the PRICE.

My first smartphone and it does everything that any other smartphone can do minus a flash for the camera.For $60 you can't beat that!The only issue I have is with the service provider AT&T, but it's a great phone!

column1: Incredible value! Stop over paying for your monthly service ...
column2: Incredible value! Stop over paying for your monthly service and bring your own phone. For $45 this phone does everything my androids and iphones do at 10% of the cost. The Windows phone OS has made huge strides of late and it's nearly on par with the others.

column1: Would not purchase again. Would rather spend the money ...
column2: Would not purchase again. Would rather spend the money towards a phone that is more user friendly. Surfing the internet is nearly impossible, it continues to shut down in the middle of reading forums or news.

Excellent little phone for the price. Well constructed and Windows 8.1 is awesome. Got it for twenty bucks on Black Friday just to play with; use it as a media PC and Roku remote. The best low end smart phone money can buy.

The 520's size and weight is so much more comfortable in my pocket and in my hand. I don't mind not having a flash or high end camera, or even LTE, all of which my 920 has. The 520 is so much more convenient. And it was very nice not to have to extend my existing phone contract.

column1: I like the phone a lot and wanted to replace it ...
column2: This is a replacement of my Nokia Lumia 520.I like the phone a lot and wanted to replace it with the same one.Nice little phone!

I got this phone for my wife as her first smartphone. She is not really into tech stuffs. So I was getting a good deal on this, I pulled the trigger. My idea was-its a smartphone, how bad could it be. That was before I knew a windows 8 device hands-on. After I got this, I thought I will try it out for a day. Man, o man, the experience was horrible. Almost all the apps that I like in Google Play or App store was unavailable. Later that day, I realized may be its a good phone for its price, but without a comparable app store, smartphone doesn't mean much.My suggestion for someone looking for a cheap smartphone: please stay away from windows phone; buy a cheap android phone.
This is my second Lumia 520.I'm still using the first one as a phone with no problems.This one I use like my iPod, only this has 64gb capacity and cost significantly less.

I got this for my husband since he has never had a sart phone and was very reluctant in getting one. This was a perfect starter smart phone for him and with in a few hours he had fallin in love with it:) That is a success in my book!

column1: At first it seems really awesome, until you find out a lot of apps ...
column2: This phone is a bit frustrating. I've had it for five or so months. At first it seems really awesome, until you find out a lot of apps aren't supported for windows phones. This phone also has the nasty tendency to duplicate media files ten or so times, making you have to scroll through a bunch of the same photo/song/video/etc to find what you are looking for, and if you try to delete the duplicates you also lose the original!That being said, the customization is nice, and I like the overall size and feel of the phone, so I will probably stick with it for a while longer.

column1: Could be good for a kids first, for emergencies and family calls. Not to great for high usage
column2: Go low get low, the 950 and up are the way to go. Kind of a tossable phone hehe

No (easy) selfies with this one camera phone but the 5MP camera works well.Apps are more limited than w/Android but MS office interface is quite handy.Nokia music free service is welcome and quite deep, love the save for offline play feature!Tiles are fun to arrange and functional too!

column1: Fast, cheap, and up to date in today's mobile world
column2: Simple and fits well in the mobile world we live in.Bought it for my dad and he likes and comfortable tinkering with it.We did not want to spend for an iPhone.Cheap and reliable, nuff said.

Love, love, love this phone! I purchased it in a recommended based on your searches. I received it really fast. It does everything you would expect, and more. I'm a 37 year old Mom, and it keeps me organized just fine!

column1: This phone is really really great for the price
column2: This phone is really really great for the price! I mean which other smart phone comes for US $19? (I got it during Christmas sale). Once loaded with the latest software updates, the performance boost is a welcome change! You cannot go wrong with this phone. An ideal gift for smart phone starters.

Got this phone to use since my other one broke. It seems to be a pretty reliable phone for the price. I dropped it a bunch of times and I did not seem to break. I still use it every once in a while! Great phone!

Christmas gift for my sister. For the price it was a fantastic buy! I highly recommend this phone! Put a straight talk Sims card in it and it is working perfect!!!!!!!!!Packaging was great, shipping was fast!

I really like this phone.Unlimited txt, the thing you have to be careful of is media usage. Do not send pictures or receive pictures, then you should be okay, unless you want to pay more for the option.

column1: you're really not going to get better than this
column2: Just bought this phone for my dad as his first smartphone, and for a $46 phone, you're really not going to get better than this.The screen quality isn't amazing and the processing power isn't what you'd get out of a flagship phone, but what do you expect for this price?If my phone (Nokia 1020) needs to be replaced before I'm eligible for an upgrade, I'm definitely either getting this or the 620 as a replacement.10/10 would buy again.

column1: I assume it works like it should
column2: Purchased for a coworker as a Christmas present. I assume it works like it should. She was using a flip phone but wanted a touch screen. She loves this one and I got it for a good price around Christmas.

column1: lets youwatch videos and take photos
column2: You get what you pay for. It's quite basic. Has access to the Internet, lets you watch videos and take photos. No bells or whistles, really. Nokias are quite sturdy in general and this phone is not an exception.

Very happy with this phone.It met all my expectations and has everything I need.Good buy.I have a couple friends who paid 4+ times what I paid for this phone and have no more features that I have with my Lumia 520.

Still not a big fan of Windows 8, but this is a very good bargain for a smart phone. You have to tweak a lot of settings to get bring the battery life within an acceptable range but that's no big deal. One of my pet peeves is cell phones that have these alternative fancy features (camera's, Web browsers, etc) but which don't function well at its basic function - being a phone. This phone offers clear reception. So no problem there.

column1: SO FAR I LIKE THIS PHONE
column2: SO FAR I LIKE THIS PHONE, IM ONE OF THE FEW THAT HAS TROUBLE WITH TOUCH SCREEN TEXTING, I WAS USED TO A LG QUANTOM THAT HAD A FLIP KEYBOARD, IF I COULD THROW THE KEYBOARD ON THIS PHONE I WOULD HAVE GIVEN IT A PERFECT SCORE.

Have had the phone for about a month and no complaints so far. Few minor things like I wish that the buttons on the bottom of the screen lit up and it had a front facing camera, but for the price it is a great phone and hard to beat.
I bought this windows phone years ago and it works just fine like it just works like new and stuff so 5 stars

column1: I was not happy with this phone at all
column2: This phone was bought to replace the lumia phone I had already been using. This was not the same phone, did not have same functions and just acted weird at times. I was not happy with this phone at all.

column1: It's a great phone for the Price
column2:
When i was going to buy this phone i got many comments from my friends go to i phone or android. But compared to the price this phone has all features i need except front camera.
but still it's manageable for considerable time. :)
I owned it for a long time and was a great phone, but just found a better one I could upgrade to and did
Great phone for the price!I use this phone with Puretalk usa.I just used the sim card I was using in my old phone and it worked right away.Good quality pictures and sound.I would buy this again.

Works fine. I needed to get a new phone cause the other one i had it broke after maybe 2 months of having it. So I need to get another one. And i heard about this phone, and i love it. I've had a windows phone before and that was probably the best phone i ever had. But this is a nice phone, nicer than the last one i had that's for surer.

column1: Great reliable smartphone for a low price! I am using this as a spare when our phones are sent for repairs
column2: I purchased this as a spare phone while my phone went to the shop. Good solid smart phone at a great price! Definitely does not compare to my Lumia 1020 though. Purchased for 30 and without a contract this is a great buy!

worth for the money, had iphone4 for 2 years, samsung S4 for 6 months - and just bought this one last month, some how i like 520 more impressive of other 2. certainly i would suggest this to anyone. for 60 bucks its great.

Bought this for my young teenager as a gift. He really likes it and enjoys all the cool features. For $40.00 bucks it surpassed my expectations. I wish I would have purchased two. Oh well, next time.Thanks,Amazon for the quick delivery even though it was out of stock at the time of checkout.

I received it in no time it was fast except I bout the case from amazon but when I tried to snap it on it dosent stay it pops back off and that made me depress hoping ing would fit yet the 520 hard case didn't fit my 520 phone...

column1: I Highly recommend this Windows Phone
column2: I like this phones ease of use, the fact that it has an expandable memory slot, it's fast for only having 8 GB, & it satisfies business needs.It's got very similar apps as Apple & Andriod, accept some games.I've only used this product for about a month & I love it already!It has a really nice camera & features.It has about a 2 day battery life, which is good.This phone has highly met my expectations & would recommend this phone to just about anyone!

I've owned the phone for a month. I like the look and feel of Windows Phone 8 and its home screen customization. Nokia and AT&T pack-in programs are a great addition as well. Battery life is better than described. However, Internet Explorer is extremely limited (even compared to its woeful PC counterpart) which led to disappointment as I hoped to use the browser regularly. The flat back design makes it way too easy to put your finger on the camera lens or get dust on it when setting it on a surface; learn from my mistake and also purchase a compatible case if you buy this phone.

column1: works great, and Windows Phone is pretty sweet
column2: Cheap, works great, and Windows Phone is pretty sweet.That said, don't look to this for a front-facing camera or a flash on the rear camera. Look to it for a simple, cheap phone that works well give the price.

Purchased this for myself. Didn't really give it a chance as I am used to my Android. Gave it to my husband and he loves this phone. Couldn't go wrong for $20.00. At the very least, can be used as a mp3 player.

Not that much different than an Android phone. Latest firmware update of Nokia Black & Win Phone 3 make this a great phone.Low price and affordable AT&T, $25 a month, no contract plan make this a winner.

Worked quite well at first, but after some use, I have found that the phone is sluggish and doesn't respond well.I have removed apps and background tasks but it doesn't seem to improve much.However, for the price, I'm happy with the phone.

column1: my secondary GPS, in dash camera and also used for photo, 720p video
column2: Nice little product... I wish this one came in android.for the price, it is a steal. I use it mainly as my secondary GPS, in dash camera and photo, video needs on picnics :)Excellent video quality

column1: It is discontinued from the manufacturer.
column2: This product is discontinued from the manufacturer so it does not support many feature.It is a good Go Phone for the price.

column1: Way smaller that the other go phones this was recommended to replace as an upgrade from Amazon
column2: Way smaller that the other go phones this was recommended to replace as an upgrade from Amazon.Looks like a knock off of an actual smartphone.

column1: I feel it is good as a backup phone in case my android ever ...
column2: This is a Windows phone so it is very limited in what it can do. However, for the price paid, I feel it is good as a backup phone in case my android ever breaks. Runs okay, but can seem laggy when multi-tasking.

My son loves this phone! He's into gaming and likes that he can use his phone to play on Xbox live . It's so easy to use and set up. Our cell phone walked you thru the process. Love the phone but dislike AT&T plan for it.

Stopped working just after I entered my Microsoft data which you are forced to do to use the phone. So I'm stuck with a phone that doesn't work which I can do nothing with because all my data is trapped inside.

If i were to compare this to an apple product, I'd say it's comparable to an iphone 4 if we'll agree the 920 is like the iphone 5.For $70 with no contract it's a great deal!!!usually a great smart phone will cost you $599 w/o a contract.great buy...get it..

column1: If you can get it on a deal price it's a steal.
column2: Loaded with features even Cortina. Got terrific price ($40) on deal of the day. Can add microSDHC card for storage (like tons of music). All kinds of downloads from Nokia, like maps and the list goes on.

column1: Great back up phone if you have AT&T or Music Video player.  Standalone gps
column2: Great phone for the money, I bought as a backup and for the GPS.I played around with it, let me kids play on it too.Plays music. videos and GPS.I can put my AT&T sim card in it if I need too.

I just received my phone today.It didn't take as long to get as I thought, about a week.I love it so far.Keep in mind if your last phones SIM card is older you cant just take it out and put it in the new phone the card is to large.I had to have the new phones card activated.Its not that big of a deal, but it is a little bit of a hassle.Just don't throw the new card out.This phone is well worth the price.

this is by far the best phone I have ever owned;the features of the phone match the price point of other phone 3 times this price;arrived quickly , described perfectly on the website , easy to use and setup was quick
For the price, it is a steal. Just to let you know, it is a locked phone. But i paid 45$ online to unlock it. So i recommend you to buy the unlocked version for a few bucks more.

column1: Best bang for the buck cell phone on the market.
column2: Best bang for the buck cell phone on the market. I refused to pay for data, so when this phone became available I jumped on it and switched my pre-paid gophone and plan to this phone. I cut my monthly minutes cost in half by using wifi and skype $3 a month unlimited calling. Bought a sim cutter to cut my sim card to micro sim size and use my existing number and adapter to switch between. All the free apps and offline gps stuff is gravy to me.

column1: Nokia showcases what they know how to do best here. While the Windows OS takes a bit ...
column2: The Lumia 520 is an example of how to make a very solid and simple to use phone. Nokia showcases what they know how to do best here. While the Windows OS takes a bit if getting used to. You cannot beat the features of this phone and the price point. Definitely recommend this phone to those not looking to spend much on a very decent smartphone

Being an iPhone user for 5 years, I can honestly say that the Nokia Lumia phones can compete with the iPhone and the 520 is just a lower model so I can image what the high end models can do. The phone is very affordable, stylish, easy to use, and I can add minutes whenever I need to. Glad I bought it.

you can't beat the price .nice backup phone.long battery life.you don't have to use ATT to activate the Phone .it will work with Walmart Straight Talk .just be sure to choose the right SIM(The one it works on ATT network)

column1: Works great, battery seems to last ok and it is ...
column2: I didn't need a fancy phone.Just something I can make calls on and play the odd game when stuck somewhere.Works great, battery seems to last ok and it is simple to operate.For the price a great deal.

column1: It is a windows phone, but it does play ...
column2: It is a windows phone, but it does play games.I bought the phone exclusively to play WP games for the gamerscore and it runs most older games.It doesn't have enough RAM to run newer games though

column1: Good Phone Especially for a GoPhone
column2: I will be fair and preface this by saying I'm typically a devout Samsung and/or Droid Market user; however, when I dropped my latest LG phone (shattering the screen), the Nokia Lumia was an inexpensive and suitable solution. The seller shipped the phone very quickly which was fantastic! Even though I had a micro SIM, I was able to put it in place well enough for it to work which is another plus. I actually like the "tile" idea and that it continuously updates my e-mails, messages, weather (etc) so I don't miss anything. Also, the GPS is just as good as any other phone I've had (maybe even better in some cases.) I also like that I don't have to call my voicemail because the name/date/time is listed along with the ability to play back the message like a regular audio recording. What are the downs? The biggest issue I have is that some of the free apps available on other markets (Words with Friends for example) aren't available or you have to pay for them. The graphics and qualities of the apps are pretty basic, too. All in all, I will eventually get a more upgraded phone, but I've got to give credit where it's due, and this phone will always remain my backup in a pinch.

This phone is OK.It does what you need.After a few months of this being my car backup phone, the battery seems to fall out even when the back battery cover is on -- almost a manufacturing defect which is not apparent until several months after you start using the phone regularly.
Nice phone.Unfortunately wanted it just for an emergency phone and to add on to my plan.It would add on on my plan but ATT requires Data for Voice Mail for this phone.Otherwise the phone works great

I bought it as second phone and this under-$70 phone is worth more than some $200 smart phone. There is many App I can use even offline GPS, but the biuld-in compass s*cks and the GPS always loss signal.

You get what you pay for. A solid, reliable device for the money. It's got a fast Windows operating system. I purchased two of these as gifts for relatives for Christmas and I now have ALL the brownie points!

I bought 2 new copies of Nokia Lum.20 ATT. Sent me them to Ukraine. Doesn't see a cellular network. I asked on the site ATT for the help, but ATT declared that if phone didn't turn on in the USA, they can help nothing. And they have no my IMI in the list. Now I wait that someone will go to America and will turn on my phones. And meanwhile, it is the wasted money.

column1: Ok phone but needs improvements on the sim card slot
column2: The phone is ok for the price i paid. But the sim card slot gave me a very hard time. The sim card didn't fit for the first time. I had to spend a lot of time trying to install the sim.. May not be the case for every one but it was frustrating to me. After sim card installation, the phone works fine without any problems.

column1: The phone itself works great, was bought to have as a back up ...
column2: The phone itself works great,was bought to have as a back up and get a sense of what the windows phones were about and wasn't impressed at all with Windows but if you need a cheap phone that will do what is needed and have decent speed for the price this is it till they get a cheaper Android!

column1: Love it!! No complaints, all praises!!

It's a gps! It's a phone!! It's cheap!!! It's lumia 520. At this price it's an easy 5 star. This lowest range Lumia phone is more responsive that some mid-level android phones with twice the price tag.

column1: Buyer beware. Eventhough the phone is paid for, ...

One of the things that happens when you leave a job in the mobile phone industry is that you stop having access to all the cool new devices. I struggled with a cheapo Virgin Mobile "paylow" flip phone for over a year. Pair a poor quality phone with a poor quality network (Sprint) and you have a recipe for disaster.My wife bought me this Nokia Windows Mobil phone and what a delightful change. Every feature (too many to list) just works.One really cool feature, the battery is USER REPLACEABLE! They must know you'll see this phone as a "keeper!"

column1: The Best Phone I have Ever Had!
column2: For less than $100.00 to pay for a windows 8 cell phone, there is no better quality product for the money.It has so many applications & very quick.I am enjoying my new phone.

column1: This is a great little basic smartphone
column2: This is a great little basic smartphone. I lost my LG G2 and I wasn't willing to pay full price on the newer phones ( not eligible for upgrade). This is a basic smartphone but comes in very handy. It is fast, sturdy, stylis and fits in the pocket . This is my first windows phone and am very happy with it. i haven't activated the phone yet. that's why i can say if i really like or if i love it, because i haven't talked on the phone yet but i did try the camera and the camcorder and i've to be honest i was kind of disappointed in the quality of the picture and video for 5 megapixel camera wich this phone has. the picture quality looked almost like my old cell phone wich had only 3 megapixel camera. but when comes to screen display it look fine. i can compared to other phones because this is my first smart phone,so i dont know how other smart phone display looks like.

column1: All my friends, children, and grandchildren will visit ...

column1: The phone is a nice entry into the world of Windows Phone
column2: The phone is a nice entry into the world of Windows Phone. It is slow in Spotify and Skype, but thats to be expected. I enjoy this very much, and it makes me want to upgrade to a better one in the future.

If you are a light to medium user you can't go wrong here. I don't need internet that much so I use a pay as you go plan with ATT. I don't have to pay a monthly for a data package but have all the neat smart phone features. You can coonnect to the internet at any wifi point for free. This is a great phone!

column1: Great features in an inexpensive package
column2: I've been a loyal android user for a few years now.After breaking my second screen in a year, and the battery on my backup Iphone 3GS dying, it was time for something new.This phone fit the bill, budget pricing with great features.I like the customizable features of the Windows 8 platform.There are things I miss about my Android phone like being able to automate certain functions I use every day. And the the app choices are not nearly to the level of android, but I have my tablet for that anyway.The battery life is amazing if you aren't using the data functions on the phone extensively.It's still not awful when using as an MP3 player or sending some texts.Using the bluetooth and streaming music will eat it's lunch though.I think it's about the right size and if I drop it and need a replacement it won't set me back $700.It works out of the box and has some nice features I wouldn't normally expect in this price point.

column1: Customizing the phone is absurdly easy and relatively intuitive
column2: Bought two of these as starter phones for my kids and it fits that role perfectly.Customizing the phone is absurdly easy and relatively intuitive.I set up the phones and tiles for them initially and liked it so much that I now think the Windows Phone software is actually better than Android,Excellent value.

I downgraded from and away from Sprint's high plan's.I chose this phone and i have to say,for the price i made a good choice! My first round with Windows 8,but for the money i scored well satisfied!!User friendly.

There are only a couple apps that I use that I can't get but then those are Google apps so it is not surprising. WiFi and the mobile hotspot features are very fast and easy to use. I read some awesome reviews about this device before I got it and all I can say is ditto. I love this phone and ordered another one for my husband which will come Saturday. Happy customer again.

column1: I'm so glad I found this phone!
column2: I needed a replacement phone for my 13 year old son.His (non smart) phone was recently lost, and he was begging for a smart phone ("everyone at school has one" - sadly, he's not wrong about that!).I really did not want to pay $$$ for an iPhone (especially given the high probability that this phone will be dropped/lost/etc.)I stumbled across this phone on Amazon and, given the great reviews, decided to give it a try.It arrived quickly and I took it immediately to the AT&T store where they gladly activated it with his existing number (part of our family plan).I played with it for a couple days before giving it to him.I'm an iPhone user myself, but not really techie.The screen is really nice and the Windows system seems easy to use.It doesn't look cheap.I think it has all the features and apps that he needs.When I finally have it to him, I could tell that he was disappointed that it wasn't an iPhone but after using it just a day, he told me "Mom, this is a really nice phone.Thanks."I can't believe I only spent $60 for this phone.I don't know how it will hold up in the long run, but for now I'm super-happy with the purchase.I feel like I got a tremendous bargain.(And, when I activated his phone at the AT&T store, I switched us to the family shared-data plan that AT&T has been promoting heavily.Our monthly bill is now actually lower than it was before, even adding his smart phone to the plan.)

After having an Apple iPhone 4 I would recommend this phone to anyone!It is inexpensive but a step up in my opinion.I will definitely be keeping a Nokia phone from now on!!I love it so much I am planning to buy the more expensive Lumia phone.

Great phone. Great price. Exactly what I needed. remember this a windows phone, not android. Even though the windows store has many apps, they are missing a lot of apps that are found in the play store, and App Store.

This phone does way more than I can use.I went with Consumer Cellular and I do not have the internet connection.But this phone could do anything you want.Very impressed.I am still figuring it all out.

This is a very cost effective phone but it's not that great.You - "Ugh, your battery sucks! Curse you!"Phone - "But I'm only 30 dollars"You - "Well I guess you are right, I can never stay mad at you for long"Pros:Cheap! It only costs 30 US dollars!Windows store! Windows store allow you to access some of the apps you could never find on any Android Play Store or IOS AppStoreThe Mix Radio! This is a cool little app in the phone! Does what its name suggests :DIts Battery! This little guy charges up FAST! But there's also a down side to the battery...Cons:Short Battery Life... What else could I say?The Touch Screen... Well it isn't that bad, but when you first use it has a horrible rubber sensation on your fingers...The Speakers... I don't see the difference between the lowest volume to the highest volume... When you set it at 30/30 volume, in quiet room it's extremely loud, and when you set it to 1/30 volume, it's still extremely loud...My Option:It's is a very cheap phone like I said before and its great for its price! But it's down side makes it's not the best thing to invest your money in. I would not suggest anybody buy this unless you really really want it. (Mine's SIM card inserting spot/place/whatever was broken when it came so I can't evencall with this phone...)I understand this is not really a good review but hopefully it helped you.

column2: This phone is great!Used this for many months as my main phone for work.I ended up switching to AT&T (because Verizon are a bunch of savages) and now use this phone as a MP3 player.

The phone on itself is not bad but I decided to give only two stars because of the Windows processor. I had to get a new phone after I broke my android phone and until I get upgrade to a new phone. Going from android to Windows suck. Windows make the navigating through the phone app. Complicated. For example, one of your contact as several phone numbers, a facebook account and one or several email addresses and you end up with a list of numbers from which you have to choose from before you can send one call. If your contact has three different phone numbers (cell,home and work) you have to choose which one you want to call,off the list were the writing is very small. No direct fast call. And navigating to use other application is fastidious. Really not user friendly, unless you spend countless hours adjusting the settings. Also, lot of applications are not compatible with windows phone. I couldn't access my email provider because it is not the common provider. Bottom line, good for people who don't use the smartphone capabilities. Sound is good, cannot custom ringtones, even following instructions. Good experience with the phone for the call part, for the rest, Windows spoil he fun of having a smartphone. Going back to android.
